title: Lovely Experince!
comment: I enjoyed my time at The Rooftop. Nice food, Great Ambience and an Excellent Service. The team treated my friend and I so well, they have suggested some food and drinks to try, took their time to explain the menu and even offered to help with the pictures. I will be visiting soon again.

title: Thank you so much!!!
comment: Myself and my partner had such a good time. Great views with nice ambience and fantastic service. Food and drinks where also very nice. Thank you so much Brian for looking after us.

title: Fantastic Rooftop
comment: I went for Saturday brunch for the first time in Rooftop St James and as soon we were seated The waiter wished me happy birthday. He gave the best service ever seen, I do highly recommend it to visit!

title: They cancelled the booking when we arrived
comment: Booked for a friends birthday 5 days in advance to be outdoors, as we were in a group not all part of the same household. Got there and we were turned away as it was raining and their outdoors is not covered. In the current circumstances they shouldn’t give the option to book outdoors (or at least give some kind of warning) if they don’t have covering, it’s winter in London so obviously the weather isn’t going to be great.

title: Lovely food and drinks just disappointing service
comment: Lovely salmon with fluffy rice! So tasty and filling.  Had some prawns for starters which were very complementary with the main dish.  Drink menu is lovely and drinks are strong.  Only negative is booked for dinner and drinks (specifically drinks on the roof) was told we would be moved to the rooftop, waited over an hour to be moved and then saw staff move a group of 4 out to the roof while we were made to stay inside which dampened the vibe.  Clesrly moved the group of 4 out as they thought they would make more money from them. Overall lovely food and drinks the service was just a little disappointing

title: Stunning view,incredible food, excellent service
comment: We were having a little celebration with my husband and we chose this restaurant. We never regretted it. The view from roof top was absolutely gorgeous. Service was exceptional from beginning until the end and made us feel so welcome.  We had 3 course meal and each dish was well presented and delicious.  Also we were impressed with amazing cocktails from the bar - beautiful and tasty.  We highly recommend this restaurant and definitely coming back.

title: Great Place
comment: We tried here just for cocktails just before dinner. It was amazing, especially when we sat outside, seeing London from above. Service was amazing, great atmosphere and tasty drinks. It's well worth a visit for the experience alone. Would go again in a heartbeat.

title: Not advisable during current Covid regulations
comment: I do not advise visiting here whilst the current government guidelines to have a substantial meal with your drink is in place. Given most people come to here for a drink before a meal, 3 small plates each as a minimum is a bit much! 3 small plates between a couple would be plenty to be considered a substantial meal. Hate to think it’s just a money making opportunity!

title: Views, staff, drinks excellent.
comment: Views, staff, drinks excellent. Food unfortunately not great. Broccoli stems too hard and knife not really sharp enough to cut them. Other food seemed generic Asian. Best food was the pulled pork bao bun, but I’d say there was too much sauce in it, and the gyoza. Got for drinks and the view.

title: Lovely setting, good service, food was just OK
comment: Went with a friend for drinks and meal - and was just a little bit disappointed in the food. It was all warm rather than hot and as were outside, it got cold very quickly. We’d shared a main but only had small side plates to eat from and a knife that couldn’t cut into the broccoli stalks (which were cold). The waiters were lovely and we enjoyed the view with our drinks. The cocktails were a little disappointing, too, for £15. Stick to the wine and gin and tonic.

title: Try it yourself
comment: The discrepancy in reviews is not surprising. Some people have a fantastic experience, other will be disappointed. First, you're going to pay for a view like this. But many places in central London are pricey. This is high, but not extreme. Second, you need to be on the terrace for the view. Not in the restaurant. Third, the food is actually pretty good. Fourth, the staff... Some are amazing, others seem still to be learning. Fifth, it's generally quite young and fun. Go enjoy yourselves!

title: Amazing rooftop drinks
comment: The place itself was amazing, great views from the terrace area. The staff was super nice and friendly, very good service, and they were accomodating to move us to better seats once a spot became available. Overall amazing experience, the drinks were also delicious!

title: Great views, slow service, food nothing special but drinks reasonably priced
comment: I booked for 3 people a 6pm seating last night. I find the £25 pp charge on credit card very steep - I understand the need to secure income aganist no-shows, but £10 would be more normal. The maitre d'h was lovely on arrival. Tables for 2 have the best views but I was happy with our table slightly back, and not to be on stools so it's more relaxed. The views are fantastic. Highly recommend. I thought the drinks prices were fine - £6 for a beer, 10 for a double G&T, 12 for cocktails. Food was nothing special but then again you pay for the location. I found the service really slow. At first we didn't mind, as we didn't feel rushed. But when we had to get up for a second cocktail, then to order the food, then to enquire about the wine which hadn't arrived, it felt like there wasn't enough waiters or barmen to serve the clientele. All in all we had a nice evening but I think service should be looked at. The last thing is that waiters didn't wear masks, and I think they should. Customers should also be asked to wear masks going to the toilets. So, more waiters and masked please!

title: A very Pleasant meal with a Stunning View
comment: I've booked a table for 2 for my wife's birthday. The place was very busy with a great atmosphere. Unfortunately we did not get a table outside on arrival but the staff have managed to move us as soon as there was availability. The service, food and the drinks were great so for us it was a very pleasant dinner with a stunning view, and I will return. Thank You for making my wife's birthday so special.

title: Thank you for a great evening!!!
comment: We finally returned to one of our favourit spots in Central London!! Superb drinks and great service as always. Management always around to make sure you are having a fantastic time.

title: Stunning views with amazing service
comment: We had the best night with amazing cocktails, fab music and delish food. The service was second to none and they even gave us a desert to celebrate our anniversary. We felt absolutely spoilt!

title: Amazing service from Constantin !!!!!
comment: I went at this amazing rooftop with my friends from work . Girls night . We meet Constantin there and honestly I don’t have enough world to recommend him . Beside the fact that he is so funny and full of life , he is super professional and he took care of us all night . It was kinda cold and he close the top part + he have us blankets . It was an amazing experience and I just wanted to give him all the credit for this . For sure we are gonna come back !

title: No rooftop view!
comment: I booked for my partner’s birthday and upon arrival were put inside as the small rooftop area was already busy. We were we told that if a space frees up they would let us know. We asked again a few more times but they seemed to let 4 sets of other guests on to the rooftop who had arrived after us and kept saying there was no room!  Disappointed as we were really looking forward to it!

title: Really disappointing, would not recommend
comment: Very unprofessional experience from the moment we arrived- staff arguing in front of us, we had to call the waiter over three times to ask him to take our order as he kept going to other tables on the walk to us and then forgetting about us. Then when we finally got to order, it came out wrong. I didn’t receive any of my order and two of my friends orders were also wrong. Asked the manager who apologised and said mine was on the way. Then the second time things were also missing from the order- it wasn’t in any way complicated I ordered 3 small plates on the menu. Service was very slow in general and then afterwards when looking at the bill we realised they swapped the white wine and were charging us for more expensive bottles than the first two. I have never had a restaurant or bar change the wine without asking us, especially to one more expensive. As it was my friends birthday, it was nice that a dessert was brought out for her but by this point there were far too many negative things to rescue our experience. Definitely would not recommend, especially for a celebration.

title: Gorgeous Views
comment: A really nice place to have a drink and and enjoy the city skyline. We were lucky we had the place to our selves... NEVER happens.

title: Beautiful rooftop bar..
comment: I have been many a time here over past 4 years , I love the view and have brought many a friend for brunch or drinks. Usually excellent service and food quality although 4 stars as I once was asked to pay the bill before being served ( which I found rather biased considering no one else was asked too and all other times I have paid after..) and on another occasion it would seem my friend and I were completely forgotten about and we had to call the manger over to be served , although he promptly served us on the house. Otherwise I would 100% recommend.

title: Stunning anniversary
comment: I visited the Rooftop with my girlfriend to celebrate our anniversary. First day of reopening and Constantin was incredible sweet and attentive. We like the new Asian concept and the views. We will come back.

title: Mums birthday
comment: Went here on the off chance they would fit us in as we didn’t book, the staff were so kind and accommodating! Would highly recommend the food we did a 3 for £25 light bites they were so good! When I’m back up in London will definitely return.

title: Celebration lost
comment: Entrance and greeting great ,but sadly that was the best we had. Shown to our table which was half set, 20 mins to wait for drinks order even though only one of 3 tables full in restaurant. Given one menu for food and then left a further 40 minutes before wine order and food. Other people arrived and yet had drink delivered. We complained as after an hour we had hoped to order ???? Chefs look amazing but food delivered eventually to table warm if that. Watching the suits walk by observing but really guys pay attention to detail and empty glasses . 2 n half hours later and still our cocktail glasses remain on table although finished . Food eaten although cold is still here even though requested to clear. I'm astounded by lack of service and standards below that we are used to in the city of London. Wetherspoons are quicker cleaner and more attentive. sadly this was my friends 50th and my.birthday too and yet being devoted Londoners and city workers we have been let down at a time where any personal experience in dining out has left us dumbfounded and so disappointed.

title: Beautiful Night
comment: We have been here for drinks and the experience was delightful. Everything was perfect from the drinks to the service! Recommend it!

title: Where do I start. Had a confirmed
comment: Where do I start. Had a confirmed reservation through Opentable. On arrival, they couldn’t find my booking. “Are you Helen” I was asked. I’m an elderly male btw!!! Showed them my booking. “Sometimes the technology gets it wrong”. No table reserved for us and despite many empty had to sit side by side, at the shelf overlooking the Square in the burning sun. Drinks ordered, and finally took our food order. 45 minutes later, asked where our food was. Then asked “would you like to order something?”. Apologies later including “I’m sorry, I ended up nattering on the phone and forgot to pass your order on”. Food arrives, 4 small plates, 2 missing. “What did you order?”. Next plate arrives, wrong, a repeat. Finally the last two. By now, 90 minutes has passed since arriving. Food was reasonable quality but poor value. Drinks, 2x 2 G&T around £65. Needed two due to the wait. Service charges and VAT added to bill. Quotations are virtually word for word, I do not lie. I’ve never given a bad review before. Guess there has to be a first. Absolute atrocious service, lack of attention and poor value for money. Recommendation: don’t bother.

title: Just breathtaking!!
comment: Me and my friend found this amazing place with a breathtaking view , amazing drinks and food to complete our night. We didn’t have a booking unfortunately but they found us a table in seconds even if it was fully booked all the stuff and owner they was very kind and helpful. I am recommending this place to everyone ❤️

title: Terrible! Service was so bad
comment: Really disappointed with this visit. Was sat at a shelf basically with uncomfortable seats. Asked to move three times and instead was ignored the whole night. Drink menu took 30 mins to come then drinks took another 30 mins. Terrible terrible service... will not be returning

title: Fantastic Evening
comment: Booked a table for 6 of us(Saturday).from the moment we arrived we were treated exceptionally well, over the 3 half hours we were here the service was fantastic with nibbles, the cocktails were great the porn stars with procceco went down well for me the old dark rum was great I also had the caprinas & mohito,at the rooftop bar you have fantastic views of Trafalgar Square and the London eye/ shard.We had a 5* service and many thanks to all your staff for a unforgettable evening.

title: Behold London
comment: The Rooftop is an amazing place for a drink and a bite to eat. I would call it casual up market. The view is astounding, a great place to take visitors to London. Champagne cocktails are their specialty and there is no Malibu, much to the disappointment of a nearby table!

title: Hotel guests pre booked shocking service
comment: We had pre booked intending to have the Champagne pairing, bottle of Veuve Clicquot yellow label and cheese fondue for 2 £130. We arrived at our booked time and were walked past the covered tables and taken to the uncovered area , I asked if the heater could be lit, but was told it’s not working, do you want a blanket. We were not offered drinks at this point , just left at the table, Due to the cold we decided just to get a drink, as guests of the hotel there is a code for your first glass of Veuve Clicquot for £10. When I enquired about this was told “ we need the code “ which I did not have as we had intended to purchase the full bottle, it felt that they expected me to return to my room to get the code which was clearly generic at this point we decided that the service and ambiance were just not worth the wait,and told them that we intended to leave. As we did so we were asked for our room number , which I provided but questioned as to why they needed it. We were told “ maybe we can send you something” at time of review the “something has not arrived” over all very disappointing.

title: Recommended for chilled Champagne in Winter warmth
comment: My wife and I spent two enjoyable hours for the bottomless champagne brunch just before Christmas. The food was not elaborate but nice and as expected as the menu was available prior to booking. The starter was a sharing platter. The bar was fairly compact with approximately 7 small tables. Although it rained heavily we were warmed by the electric heaters and dry under the canopy. The champagne flowed freely as one would expect. A lift brought you conveniently to the Rooftop bar, but the nearest toilets were down a flight of stairs and the tables were high and you sat at bar stools so anyone in a wheel chair might want to check in advance access and seating. The staff were polite and attentive. We booked through the Opentable App which within the same confirmation e mail in separate paragraphs said our table was reserved for 90 minutes and 120 minutes which was irritating. In fact our glasses were topped up for the last time at 105 minutes which seemed acceptable for a 120 minute reservation.

title: Restaurant - Nice atmosphere, fair food and service
comment: We were walking around the area and looked for somewhere to eat that wasn't another pub. This looked like a classy establishment. It was mid-afternoon, so it wasn't too busy. We were seated right away, but service was slow. We shared a few dishes: Spiced Nuts, Hummus, Tuna Tartare and a Chopped Chicken Salad. The nuts were good, the other dishes were unimpressive.

title: Rooftop Bar Experience
comment: Decided to come in for a drink before heading to dinner somewhere else. Overall didn't find the staff that attentive and the drinks took about 20+ mins to arrive. Honestly didn't find the cocktails worth £14-£16 each. Good atmosphere though, but doubt we will visit again.

title: New Years Day Parade but on a roof top bar
comment: You must try this roof top bar it’s lovely. Lots of heaters and blankets to keep you warm with a lovely bottle of Verve. You can see the parade not brilliantly but you can definitely see it. This suited us as we did not want to stand in the crowds. We enjoyed the ambience and the light snack foods were lovely. They bought out a little plate of birthday treats for my husband as this was a surprise present, such a lovely touch. The staff were very attentive and welcoming. Happy New Year to you all and thank you again, looking forward to returning.

title: Outstanding views of the city
comment: Great evening spot for a glass of bubbly, we headed up at 5pm just as it opened to get a table near a heater. Fabulous views - one of the better roof top bars in London. Cocktail menu and nibbles are great. Well worth a visit, dress warm but there are heaters and blankets, we were nice and snug.

title: Cozy place for drinks and dinner with a fantastic view of central London!
comment: Since we were staying at the hotel St. James, my husband and I decided to try their rooftop restaurant. Perfect timing too since we made reservations for the day we were coming back from a tour of the countryside (Stonehenge and Windsor). We figured for convenience after a long day, dinner and drinks here would be best. It sure was perfect because it rained that late afternoon! Been sunny the 2 full days we were exploring the country. Due to the rain we could not have drinks at the outdoor bar (floor is slippery) but it did not stop us from enjoying the view. Dinner was good too. Not too many items to choose from but there's still a good variety of dishes. It wasn't our best meal in London but overall, it was good. Service was superb. Servers were very attentive, checking in on us and not having to chase anyone for anything.

title: View was good and nice atmosphere
comment: View was good and nice atmosphere however service was shocking. Being a Hilton gold card member I really expected more. Originally was turned away and told would have to book so went back up to the room and phoned reception and was told we could go straight up..... confused.... couple hours later we phoned reception to see if there was room which we were told yes we could go straight up and still got told by rooftop receptionist to wait to see if we were allowed up. More time wasting. After being seated we were waiting some time before being served (I even went to order at the bar and was told to have a seat as it was table service). To top it off, after asking for the bill, 3 people who asked for the bill after myself were served before me. Not impressed. Wouldn’t bother visiting.

title: Not a high standard place, such a disappointment
comment: The customer service was disappointing and fair to say schoking. We waited for drinks to be delivered over 30 minutes each time and it was not exceptable. We have ordered some nibles for the table and the order was not delivered for over 1hour, plus we needed to remind multiple times to waiting staff regarding this and no one could simply bring it.  The rooftop itself is super nice but that's the only good thing I could say about this place, otherwise the place does not meet the high standards.

title: Awesome
comment: The rooftop as a view over Trafalgar Square which is just a stones throw away from The Trafalgar Hotel of which the Rooftop bar belongs, very nice at anytime of the day, but very nice to come back to after being out & about in London & coming back to the rooftop for a drink.. very relaxing..

title: Wow
comment: hat a stunning location! The bar overlooks Trafalgar Square and it is stunning. They serve great cocktails!

title: Breakfast is a must!
comment: The service and selection was wonderful. While we did come up in the evenings, the morning was the best! Great views, service, and menu. I loved the Eggs Royale! Looking forward to our next visit.

title: Nightmare
comment: The view is great if you are at one of the 4 tables with a view. If not then it’s terrible. Check out the menu before going. Really limited. We visited a day early to request a good table. That didn’t work out.  The service was subpar. Slow. This one is a pass.

title: Wouldn't revisit
comment: This is the second time I have visited. Both times were not up to expectations. We reserved a table and the view over Trafalgar Square cannot be faulted. We were seated promptly and service was good up until this point. We waited ages for our order to be taken. We had to get off our seat and asked the lady who seated us to take our order. It is not a large area and there was no excuse for not noticing us. We placed the order and asked if we could have the dishes staggered. No problem. However the dishes came altogether. When we mentioned this to the waitress she said the kitchen was too small for us to have a starter first and then a main dish! Food nothing spectacular and not very warm either. As you can imagine this wasn't cheap eats. They lumped on a massive service charge which had I been paying I wouldn't have paid.

title: Great view - Terrible Service. Go elsewhere.
comment: Stone-faced, unfriendly staff, which was in huge contrast to the hotel staff (where we were staying). Don't expect prompt or helpful service, but the food / drinks were good. View is great, but I wouldn't go out of your way to stop by unless you happen to be in the area. Also, wear layers in the fall / winter. They have heat lamps but it's still quite cold.

title: Overrated
comment: We visited this bar to celebrate a 30th Birthday, we originally asked to be upstairs on the rooftop as the views are incredible! However, after waiting 15 minutes to be seated outside we settled for sitting inside- the decor was boring and the service incredibly slow.  We decided to head to the bar downstairs where the decor was more suited and the service was more acceptable.  This place was ok, however there are better places to spend your money within London

title: amazing view and smart atmosphere but service must improve
comment: I visited the venue on Friday night. The view from terrace is amazing (even though the space outside is limited to a very small part of the roofbar). The fact that they have such a valuable asset, guaranteeing a certain number of visitors, maybe did not stir them to invest on service and customer care. My friend had booked over the phone for 10 and left his name and credit card details (!!!) We were quite disappointed when we arrived and we found out that our reservation was not recorded. The guy downstairs was not very helping but fortunately we found a very efficient and kind girl from Sicily upstairs who found a table for us and looked after us with smile and good manners. She is the only reason why I have given 2 stars and not 1. When we sat the waiters forgot an order and were not focused on tables: we had to struggle to call for ordering. This is a pity because the place has a great potential but service is not appropriate for such a beautiful venue and above all does not reflect the high prices we were charged.

title: Amazing views
comment: This is a unique place in London, so you pay premium prices. Some reviewers seem to expect pub prices. We went for dinner, and ate very good tapas, plus a plate of meat. Two rounds of cocktails , plus two bottles of wine, added up to a substantial bill, but no more than I would have paid in a reasonable quality restaurant. The extraordinary view makes it a unique experience. We found the young staff to be enthusiastic and responsive. We would definitely return. This has to be the ultimate London venue for New Year's Eve.

title: Waited for 40 minutes and no one cared?
comment: My friend and I stopped here for drinks. Waited about 25 minutes to have our order taken. Then 10 more minutes went by and they came back to take our order again. The table next to us, who were seated after us, then got their drinks delivered and we were still waiting.  This place was not busy. When we mentioned to the server we’d been waiting a long time he didn’t seem concerned so we said we were leaving.  Also mentioned it to the host who just said they’re really busy, but they had lots of open tables so not sure what busy means exactly. Maybe only go when it’s empty.

title: Spare space but wouldn't allow anyone else to sit outside
comment: Arrived here without a booking mid Saturday afternoon and though there were a good number of free chairs and a couple of tables they wouldn't let us sit outside. We weren't impressed so left.

title: A hidden gem
comment: Hooray, we had sunshine for a few days, so where better to go for lunchtime drinks, with great views across Trafalgar Square and down Whitehall than the Rooftop. We had an enjoyable chilled bottle of Rose along with some olives, in addition to the complimentary nibbles, by the friendly and helpful staff. Wine prices are inevitably a little on the high side, but there also a good range of cocktails and the quality of the wine and service reflected the price.

title: C
comment: We had co cocktails here on a chilly day recently service is fine drinks were ok also probably return

title: City trip date night experience
comment: Canadian/German couple from Düsseldorf on a „date night“ during a short city trip to London. Table booked in advance for 19:30, „…a sunset view would be lovely“. After being greeted at the downstairs reception, (and a quick telephone confirmation upstairs), we were in the elevator and on our way. The doors open, and there was the first of many (authentic!) smiles. The employees were all, without exception, very friendly! We were brought out to the terrace and soaked in the 5-star atmosphere. - Many people who have written negative reviews either didn’t reserve a table, or, quite frankly, did not realize that this is a prime London location. If you’re wearing a tshirt and shorts, carrying a backpack after sweating in the tube, I would think you wouldn’t be seated on the terrace next to an ambassador or international business-people. You don’t need a tux, but „dress to impress“! (At least „casual-chic“.) Cocktails: „La Dolce Vita“ = wow, … but a word of warning about the aromatic and delicious „Ciao, Amore!“ Unbeknownst to us, the glass is sprinkled on the outside with a fine dust of chocolate powder. The condensation from the cold glass has a „liquifying“ effect on the outside, leaving melted chocolate on your hands. if your not careful, (which I wasn’t) there will be a happy little accident on your face, or on your clothes. A warning from the staff when serving this piece of art would be very helpful. Food: If you order the yummy „Chicken & Avocado Chopped Salad“, be aware that there are (a lot of) cashews on top. Better yet, just let the staff know about what you’re allergic too before you order. „The Rooftop“ has a wonderful view, an unforgettable vibe, and authentically(!) friendly staff. If you’d like your evening in London to be very special, consider experiencing this romantic bar/restaurant on top of The Trafalgar St.James hotel.

title: Don’t hype up your expectations
comment: The place itself has a great view on London and terrace is modern however we were disappointed with food quality and service. I wouldn’t recommend going there for a meal but maybe for a nice drink only

title: Rude staff
comment: The host informed us we could not sit in the sun and must sit by the door. 2 minutes later 2 more people were offered a seat any where they wanted and again the next people were offered the same. The service was terrible and took 15 minutes to receive 2 cocktails...we cancelled the order and walked out! Much nicer rooftop bars all over and prices do not jut suit the service.

title: Rude Staff
comment: Incredibly rude front of house staff on the ground floor. Quite a cool venue and the best views are on the first terrace as you come out of the lift. This being said, the impolite staff will stop me coming back again. (It seems to be a common theme with other comments on here!)

title: The place lives from its location, but nothing else.
comment: Based on today’s dining experience - Slow service  - Told not allowed to move table by manager despite waiter explicitly agreeing to this - being rebuffed by the waitress “I need to go now, we are very busy” - requires to deposit a credit card despite already providing details via open table  - don’t accept open table dining voucher despite not having opted out of the scheme and using open table for their bookings All in all a very average experience, or sub par to be frank. Food was okay once we got it. It takes a while.  The place lives from its location, but nothing else.

title: Book the front bar to overlook Trafalgar Square
comment: Excellent place to go must pre-book though and ensure you have booked the front bar is my top tip. Great service and lovely atmosphere. Went back again recently (this review) and still a great place to go with the views across Trafalgar Square we had a good afternoon with friends here!

title: Enjoyed our time at the rooftop bar
comment: Booked here as part of a day out in London to celebrate our daughters 30th. I was a bit worried about the mixed reviews, but we have always wanted to visit a roof top bar and where better to experience our first one than in London and as part of a family celebration.  We were lucky with the weather and enjoyed our time here, great drinks, great setting and all the staff we dealt with were brilliant, friendly and service with a smile. Loved every minute of the time we spent here, thank you to all those who made our visit, a memory we will look back on with a smile, got some cracking photos, had some lovely drinks in a wonderful setting. So glad we chose to go here

title: Location location location
comment: Fabulous location fabulous small tasting dishes great service but in fairness was a private event. But beautiful place that’s always worth a special occasion.

title: Great views service and drinks
comment: We dropped by with my family: 2 seniors, 2 adults and 2 kids (5 and 3 yrs old). Staff (Max) accommodated all of our needs! They arranged something special for the kids and they loved it!!! Try the Bye Bye Ben with Pork Belly Buns!

title: Outstanding!!
comment: I booked a table here at the very last minute, just a couple of days before actually visiting. As it was March, the weather wasn’t great but with the canopy’s and heaters it didn’t matter at all. The staff are so friendly and can’t do enough for you, even offering us food even though we only had a drinks reservation. Yes, the drinks are on the expensive side but it’s central London, it’s expected. However, the absolute best thing about the place is the view. An amazing cityscape, while you enjoy your drink of choice. You have to visit this place!

title: Lovely
comment: Visited with a friend for a drink on the roof top bar. The staff we encountered throughout the hotel were pleasant and friendly. The rooftop bar is lovely with gorgeous views! Unfortunately we couldn’t stay as it had a private event coming up but the staff were friendly and apologetic. They helped inform us of other roof top bars around. Would have been amazing if we could have stayed but really appreciate the service here, well done and thank you!

title: Gorgeous Day, Fabulous Views
comment: This will be one of the most unique views of Trafalgar Square you will have. You can sip a cocktail looking over the square and the London skyline, away from the hustle and bustle. It is a gorgeous hotel too, and you have to go through the reception to go up to the bar. This is a great place for pre-cocktails, and romantic drink or two.It is not too big so if busy can feel a bit squashed in, but the service is very good, as are the cocktails so a definite must do if in the area. Also NO SMOKING on the terrace.

title: Very expensive and drinks not great, but pleasant service and views
comment: Came here with family for pre-dinner drinks. Service was pleasant although slow at times as the place was constantly busy and they seemed to struggle to cope a little. We ordered a porn star martini (£15) which is the worst one I have ever had (didn't have any passion fruit or any taste of passion fruit, and was an almost entirely clear drink), a pint of Peroni (£8.50) and an amaretto sour (£14). Service of around 12.5% was automatically added. Views were good but were were on one of the tables closest to the interior, and so we had to stand by other people at their tables to see the view. It was a lovely evening weather wise though so a nice place to be if that's the case.

title: Stunning position.
comment: Fabulous views but a little crammed which makes service slightly chaotic. An outdoor seat with a city view to remember.

title: Ideal Location but let down by staff
comment: Had evening food here and whilst you couldn't fault the food, the staff were not up to standard. We were in no rush but ad to find staff to order food and then walked up to the bar to pay the final bill. Then there is the audacity for a service charge when the service was so poor. Will not be visiting again when other options are available nearby

title: Amazing view
comment: Wow what a bar. Best view of Trafalgar Square and London skyline. Staff very welcoming. Cocktails lovely. Best to pre book as it’s a very popular bar with limited space where the best views are. We will definitely return.

title: Blooming Evening with London Views
comment: Myself and my partner had a beautiful evening a The Rooftop, sat in there with a stunning London view. The staff were friendly and welcoming, nothing was too much trouble.  we were well and truly spoiled and will return again soon.

title: A VISIT TO THE ROOFTOP BAR
comment: We visited the hotels rooftop bar during the hot spell in July. The three rating is merely for the view and not much else. Firstly the hotel need to train their staff.When asking what tonic do they serve with Hendricks gin,the girl replied fizzy!! Secondly when I am paying £15+ for a gin and tonic I expect it to be served properly,in a g+t “goldfish bowl” glass,with plenty of ice and a garnish,not in a feeble tumbler with hardly any ice and just a slice of lemon. Needless to say I wasn’t impressed,so I suggest the hotel ups it’s game,or they will be receiving more reviews similar to this one.

title: Disappointing service
comment: Arrogant staff trying to be nice as you enter but could not be less interested in customer service. Overpriced wine served in cheap glassware. It was like paying "Ritz" prices for wine but drinking it in a "Premier Inn" glass. How the management can get this so wrong? Where is the quality value? The servers were just rushing around without any direction avoiding eye contact from people desperate to order more drinks or ready to pay for their bills. Very disappointing.

title: Nice space, slow service
comment: The view of Trafalgar Sq (and Whitehall rooftops) is unparalleled, but the outdoor space is not huge and fills quickly. Staff were friendly but service very slow, especially considering how extortionate the drinks were (£16). To be expected but maybe employ another bartender...

title: Spend your money elsewhere
comment: To accommodate party of 20 without a minimume spend of several hundred pounds, we had to book 3 tables. The bar then contrived to put our tables in 3 different areas. One of which was totally empty. But they then refused to co locate us, accusing us of being aggressive. In light of blatant provocation, we were admirably restrained. We took our money elsewhere. Bear in mind this was a party organised by the mother of the bride. Well behaved, well organised, but the bar were determined to thwart us. Take your money elsewhere.

title: Terrible service, below average food, high prices, got bumped from the terrace
comment: My wife and I were taking a trip to celebrate our wedding anniversary. We stayed in London and for our first night there, I reserved a table so that we could eat and have a nice romantic dinner overlooking London. After arriving on the top floor, the host tells us that it is starting to rain so we don't want to be outside and that he could set us up inside. I thought they would have areas inside that also have a view and thought well this will work out even better. It did not. He sat us where we did not have a view of anything in a less than ordinary spot. Not the idea for a romantic dinner date I had in mind. We waited for quite a while before someone finally came to take our order. We looked at the drinks to which we do not find anything that tempts us for the exorbitant prices they have listed. The menu is limited: burger, fish & chips, ribeye steak for $35, or a salad. I got the burger which was OK, but certainly not worth $15. Wife got the fish & chips that she could not continue to eat, and we paid a bunch of money to then leave to go somewhere else to actually get something good to eat for supper. On our way out, we look outside on the terrace which is full of people enjoying the night views on a non-rainy rooftop terrace. The host had even brought some of them blankets to help keep them warm on an otherwise cool night. We were well-dressed for our date night, so I am not sure what was the host's problem. We decided to give the place another shot for breakfast. We were sat for breakfast in the same room - no view - for breakfast. We had opted for the Full English Breakfast which was $25, but included on a' la carte item you could order as well as the buffet offered. After waiting for about 15 minutes trying to flag someone down to come take our order for the a' la carte and coffee we wanted. Finally, I grabbed a waiter walking through the room and asked him to take our order which he did. But he never brought our coffee. I then found one guy that appeared to be the manager and asked him for the coffee which he brought. The buffet offered a pretty good assortment of items but all were OK; nothing special. The a' la carte food was good. Finally, we finished eating a average breakfast for a huge price tag with no view and terrible service. Do yourself a favor and spend your money elsewhere where you can get better food or just as good food for way cheaper. This is a fantastic hotel that's only flaw we found was the Rooftop.

title: Sunday drinks
comment: We visited the bar for drinks on a Sunday afternoon. The balcony overlooking Trafalgar Square was busy but there were a few spare tables. We asked if we could sit at one but they said they were all booked. So we sat in the part at the back which was ok but nothing special. The service was really slow where we were as it seemed they concentrated on the front part. We eventually got served and had our drinks. As we left we noticed that the tables that were empty when we arrived were still empty and there were even more empty tables overlooking Trafalgar Square. I am sure it would have been good customer service to see if we wanted one of these tables and if people had arrived we would have been more than happy to move. We will not rush back.

title: Afternoon drinks too much to ask
comment: To summarise we were served unbelievably slowly for a near empty bar, charged more than the menu price for our drinks (which are significantly above average - £21 for a white wine spritzer), and rudely treated whilst we were there. Fortunately the view comprises for the shocking service, but still left us feeling very unwelcome. Wouldn’t return.

title: Great place for drinks before dinner and meeting friends
comment: Lovely few from the top to see the Trafalgar Square, great place to drink and relax and have conversation with friends and family. The service was good, the waitstaff are very attentive if you need some drinks. Lastly wonderful atmosphere

title: Fantastic birthday lunch!
comment: Booked in to the Madison roof top restaurant for my wife’s birthday lunch. Staff were amazing, attentive, friendly and very helpful. Food was great (starters followed by lobster roll and duck burger) and wine was nicely chilled. Service was great too. Some nice touches by the staff to make the birthday treat special which was really appreciated. Not the cheapest place to eat/drink but we’ll worth it for the quality of the food and service plus the views. Ambiance was good, buzzing bar. Sunshine added to the experience. Will recommend.

title: Very poor service
comment: I had a friend visiting from abroad and after lunch nearby we decided to have a drink at the Rooftop.  We were seated at The Deck and then had to wait for over 5 minutes to be acknowledged, then served. And it wasn’t even busy.  We ordered a coffee and a prosecco, after a while I had to signal that we were still waiting, the waitress then came with the prosecco only and asked my friend to remind her what he’d ordered! The coffee turned up a few minutes later.  When we asked for the bill it took so long I had to wave to the waitress to remind her, still no bill. We eventually had to walk to the bar to ask to pay.  As I said, it was not busy. There were a few empty tables.  I paid nearly £20 for a coffee and a prosecco.  Appalling.

title: Excellent View of London
comment: A lovely spot for a drink or two on a summers day. The bar offers a range of cocktails, wines and a few ciders. Friendly staff and a pleasant trip.

title: Excellent
comment: I have been many times to this rooftop and never disappoints. The location and views are beyond expectations and the stuff very kind, quick and efficient. I would highly recommend this place if you have family over, for a date or just to have a nice drink outside. Great stuff !

title: Shocking
comment: Just had a couple of meetings here (2nd April). Prior to meeting I ordered a burger with no cheese. Eventually the meal rocked up but burger had cheese. Not the end of the world and they subsequently took the burger to be re done BUT left the bowl of fries!! After a further 10 minutes my burger arrived and so did my meeting. The waitress apologised and that was that. I put the meal in the next table (untouched) having told the waitress that it doesn’t matter and I will get something later. She decided to simply leave the burger and fries in the table next to me. Failing to clean up during the 50 minute meeting. Once my client had gone she very kindly came over and offered “to re-heat” the burger. I was obviously gobsmacked and simply assumed her pigeon English meant she meant to say she would get another fresh burger. Five minutes later a re-heated burger and a mixed bowl of cold and fresh chips arrived. I was lost for words

title: Cocktails with a different view of Trafalgar Square
comment: Came here for pre-dinner cocktails. (eating elsewhere) Not the cheapest, but reasonable for central London with some great and different views.  Spicy Espresso Martini was excellent. Nice, friendly and helpful staff

title: Great Valentines meal in a fabulous venue
comment: The view from the roof top over Trafalgar square and the National Gallery was a fantastic start to the evening. The service and the food was amazing. Overall a great evening.

title: Cocktails with a view
comment: Having previously turned up hoping for a table with no joy I booked a table online this time.  At the time of booking I was required to input my card details as a ‘no show’ fee would be charged. Probably a bit ott taking a deposit just for a drink but hey ho.  The rooftop is small so this is presumably why a security deposit is taken. Cocktails are pricey and yes, there is a service charge but this is a premium central London bar with a lovely view of the skyline. This certainly isn’t a run of the mill kind of bar. All other London rooftop bars come with a price tag and a service charge, you pay for what you get.  Staff were friendly and provided blankets to keep cosy whilst sat outside.  I had a great time at the rooftop st James taking in the views and having a great cocktail. I actually thought it was good value for money. I would recommend this bar and hope to return soon.

title: Cocktails with a view if you are lucky
comment: This bar has amazing views over London, we booked in advance asking for a table with a view but unfortunately ended up with one in the middle of the bar. Some people left so we managed to move to get a little bit of a view of Trafalgar square but not the best view. Nice cocktails but expensive, this wasn't unexpected, we knew we would be paying for the view but just a shame we didn't get it

title: Poor service
comment: We Had to give CC details to reserve a space at the bar for 4 off us and was told a fee would be taken if we did not turn up, was given the time of 5.15pm on Good Friday. When arriving we was taken to the bar at the back of the rooftop that has very little view of London, was not aware that there was 2 parts to the rooftop bar. One with a view and one without so not a good Start, would have thought that when booking a table that would ensure you had one with a view and this is something that you should be made aware of when booking that you may not get a table with a view. Ordered some drinks Easter special and a Nearly 310. And a bottle of processco , The Easter special looks nice a bit sweet for my taste, the Nearly 310 yet again a bit sweet and I could not taste the Rum in it at all. The worst thing was the bottle of Processco was served warm which in a 5star Hotel is not acceptable,  1. I do not understand why the bottles would be stored in a warm location 2. I do not understand why any Barman would think it’s acceptable to serve a warm bottle. 3. Why the Waitress thought it was acceptable to open and pour 2 glasses out when she must have felt that bottle was not chilled This is very poor service from the bar staff and you wonder how well they have been trained. We complained and another bottle was brought over this was colder still not as cold as I would expect but just about drinkable, we complained about this and the fact we did not have a table in the area that we thought we had booked and after a few minutes we was moved to the nice part of the rooftop terrace and now had a view. Ordered a spiced espresso martini and a Mojito I had the martini had a nice taste of the spiced rum. But the foam on the top had what tastes like ice crystals init not what I would expect at all once these had melted it was quite a nice drink Ordered some food Chicken Karage buns, Salmon Bread, Artichoke Flatbread, Fries. All nice if quite small portions for the money charged. Then had a Bye Bye Ben and Toast Larger, The Cocktail this time we a excellent nicely flavoured the grapefruit bitters working well with the Gin, My Mate really liked the larger so at least we had one good drink. The View from the rooftop section of the bar we ended up in was fantastic, but I felt the service was slow there only seemed to be 2 waiters working which is not enough for the amount of tables in this section , we had to keep asking for the drinks menu as its not left on the table, we also seemed to be the only table that didn’t get any nibbles put out with our drinks. We’d spoke to a lady called Pau ?? Who I believe was the under manager on call this evening and the help from her was amazing it was because of her we did not end up walking out when the warm processco was served up, we brought all these issues up with her nad she was the one who ensured we got moved to the nice part of the bar and ensured the cost of the bottle of processco was taken of the bill, she is a asset to the Hotel was very apologetic about our issues. I have drunk in many of the best cocktail bars in London. The Dandylyan, The Rumpus Room, The Ned, Bar Swift, The American Bar. The Beaufort Bar to name a few and these are all in a different league to the bar here. The View is worth going for but that’s about all I can recommend it for

title: Rooftop bar
comment: Cool bar, amazing views and location. Bar food mediocre, I had crispy duck bao bun, tasted like fish and wasn’t crispy. Service terrible. Definitely worthwhile stopping by for one drink, just manage your service expectations.

title: Woefully lackimg
comment: Yes the view was fab and the cocktail prices were as expected but that was as good as it got. Despite booking ahead they originally seated us on a high table right at the entrance to the rooftop. We asked to be moved and they had to clear away dishes from an empty table in the sun. We had to be asked twice to be served drinks and 3 times requested tap water. The toilets ran out of toilet paper and soap - no one replenished and there were plenty of complaints. The plant life needed some care and attention for sure. I wouldn’t return again having spent £130!

title: Beautiful views
comment: Went for drinks and dinner before a theatre trip. Views were stunning. Clean and tidy. Food was great, had fish and chips, limited menu. Staff were fine but not over friendly and busy so had to wait for orders to be taken.

title: Over priced
comment: Visited the Roof Top for a birthday treat. Paid a lot of money to make a reservation but couldn't get onto the tables that overlooked the lovely view. We instead had a table at the back of the restaurant and all we viewed was the kitchen and a wall. Couldn't say that the service was that good as we went to the bar ourselves. The actual service charge was astronomical. One good point is the cocktails were lovely but do not think we will be repeating the experience as It was a great let down.

title: Amazing
comment: Bit expensive but really good place to have a drink with friends or partner. The view is amazing and you're in the heart of the town.

title: Book in advance even just for drinks
comment: Made an online drinks only reservation for 12, which seems to be opening time for this rooftop bar as we had to wait to exact time before taking lift as they were getting things ready. We're shown to bar seats direct edge terrace for great views of all main London sites. Trafalgar square, big Ben, shard, London eye. Definitely great to see this view. Ordered a champagne cocktail and a boozy bye bye Ben short. £15-£18. Waitress didn't know which which even though champagne was served in a flute. A little training in order. A complimentary bowl nuts provided and blankets if a chill. Had some light rain and the awning came over.  I ordered a side of salted edamame beans, never tried before but arrived looking like sure snap or mange tout. However I quickly found out you should not eat the shell. Maybe the waitress should not assume customers know this. Toilets located in basement as you leave were well appointed with individual cloth towels.

title: Perfect for drinks
comment: Visited the rooftop on Saturday evening having previously made an online reservation. On arrival we were seated in the gallery as staff said there were no tables available outside and when we asked about being moved if one came available the waitress appeared surprised that we had made a reservation but were seated inside. After speaking to the person in charge we were shortly moved when a table became available and staff were very apologetic. It was apparent that the tables outside were like gold dust and you had to move quickly to get one. Once settled we had a lovely evening. The view is amazing, especially at night. The heaters made it nice and cosy and we spent the evening enjoying the beautiful skyline at night. Would definitely recommend!

title: Definitely worth going
comment: I went there a week ago, and it was lovely! It was cold but you get blankets an the views of trafalger sq make up for it! It would be lovely if you could get there in summer to get a view of sunset but either way it's worth going. The food is good, service is great and everything is clean and tidy. It can be expensive, so make sure you are going after pay day, but definitely worth visiting and great for a special occasion.

title: Thank You, for making a Special Occasion even more Special.
comment: Hi Federico and the team at The Rooftop St James,  Thank You ever so much for making our evening so special. It was a special weekend in London for my wife’s birthday and we had been to the theatre earlier and spent the rest of the evening at The Rooftop.  The weekend was very important to us as we were invited to the 1st world war centenary parade on remembrance day at The Cenotaph by the government. I booked your Rooftop and we were extremely happy with the perfect location and most of all the excellent and friendly service from you and the team.  You all made a perfect weekend even more special. Thank You and a Merry Christmas to you all. We will definitely be back.

title: A great rooftop bar
comment: We have wanted to visit for a while now. A great place for a drink, with views over Trafalgar square. It was a wet day when we visited but did not spoil the experience. Cannot wait to go back in the summer.

title: check this out!
comment: sexy place, fantastic drinks and woow , so many views . Everything is perfect for a memorable night out with friends. great spot and night out, thats for sure.

title: What a view
comment: Roof top adjacent to Trafalgar Square, brilliant views of London. Indoor and out door areas, blankets available and numerous gas heater. Bar food available really enjoyable.

title: Roof Top Bars
comment: There are many roof top bars in London with far better views. This bar overlooks Trafalgar Square which you only see if you get a table on the perimeter of the wall. The cocktails are quite expensive. I would say its worth visiting once, just to say you've been.

title: Perfect
comment: We visited for a cocktail before a meal in the restaurant. It was a great experience - lovely staff, excellent cocktail and a wonderful view.

title: Once only
comment: Visited here last night. Welcoming reception and sent up in the lift. Seated right away with a lovely view over T Square. Waiting staff were friendly and professional. Drinks werent up to scratch for the $$$ bit pricey. I had a martini and only got half a glass full. My next cocktail was also unimpressive given the price. We had a nibble, chicken soft Chinese bun things. Again, expensive for the quality. My bun was wet and claggy. Overall it was a lovely experience, but wouldn't return as the quality of produce for the price is not up to expectations of such a landmark hotel.  Toilet were clean. Well worth a visit for a date night. Four cocktails and a little nibble £85

title: Fabulous views and great service.
comment: It was my first visit. The views were amazing from the rooftop. I was met at the entrance by one of the hosts and shown to the table on the edge of the bar. Once I sat down and order my drinks and food I had a little time to look around and take some pictures. When I was doing this Leanne Trataris noticed me and came over to ask if I need any help. I was happy to had this happen since I was there to see if I can come back another day with a larger group. Leanne then shown me around and explained all the details of the different locations and the dinning options. I was quite happy of the details and by that time have had the opportunity to taste some of the food that I ordered. I booked a venue for a future date and left extremely happy that I have discovered a great location with a fabulous food and superior service experience with a great bunch of staff that's really well tuned to the customer needs.

title: Great view
comment: great view, not too expensive and not too full - amazingly. there was a bit of uncertainty about being able to get a table outside but they managed to find one in the end. Nice for dates.

title: Mortgage needed
comment: I have been here once before and thought it would be nice to return. Weather wasn't great but blankets (when they eventually arrived) were warm. Service Haphazard and two identical drinks (served at different times - my friend arrived after me) were completely different. Difficult to get waiters attention and had to ask a few times to get things. The £60.75 price for 3 G&T's and a soft drink was eye watering! Especially having a £6.00 service charge! What service? I would have argued but it took us all our time to get the bill and we had trains to catch. View was nice but not that nice.

title: Rooftop Gem
comment: Lovely Rooftop bar with fantastic views over London. The bar had a nice chilled vibe and I had an amazing Cosmopolitan!

title: Superb watching dusk fall over Trafalgar Square and beyond.
comment: We met friends for a drink, mid November around 4pm. Sipping champagne on the Rooftop, with helpful staff, good service and warm blankets for those of us who feel the cold was excellent. Dusk fell and the views over nighttime London were excellent. We will be back.

title: Special evening !
comment: I proposed to my girlfriend at The Rooftop a couple of weeks ago. It was a perfect setting. The views were stunning as you sit outside on the terrace and there was also heating, so despite it being a chilly evening it was still good to sit outside. The staff were really friendly and helped take some photos of the moment when I proposed. They then bought us out some champagne and deserts on the house. We really did have a special evening . The drinks / cocktails selection is really broad but they also had beers / ciders too. Will definitely be back again soon. Phil

title: Excellent 30th Birthday Celebration
comment: The staff were lovely and they surprised us with a delicious birthday treat, which was most unexpected, but they must have noticed that we were having a family celebration. The cocktails were very nice, the heaters were on and we had blankets. With brilliant views, all in all a great experience.

title: Great view
comment: We are staying at the hotel and decided to pop in for a drink. What an amazing view.  Drinks are not cheap but you are in one of the best restaurants in town. Totally amazing view. Gotta visit

title: Lunchtime visit
comment: What an excellent lunch we had on Friday.The service was exactly as it should be friendly and attentive but not rushed or hurried. Our 3 courses were throughly enjoyed and we thought the portion sizes were generous. All finished off with a fabulous cocktail on the rooftop. Superb value for money

title: Disappointing
comment: I booked in advance for drinks at the rooftop bar, from the description on the website i was expecting an open rooftop with heaters and blankets provided while you enjoy the view. As my boyfriend and I walked in i was shocked to find there was no open rooftop like in the the pictures on the website,it looked like a standard bar with nothing special to any other in London. I also requested for seats by the edge for the best view of Trafalgar square. As it wasn't very busy i expected a good seat, we then got to our seats and realised the view was terrible. We were facing a building and could see Trafalgar sq out of the corner of my eye,there were sliding glass windows in front of us which made no difference once opened as the view was still of the side of a building.  We were sat there 20 minutes before a very moody waiter walked past and I asked him if we had to go up to the bar to order, he said no and hesitantly took our order. Drinks are also around £15 each which i wouldn't have minded paying if there was a nice view and atmosphere but there wasn't. I also let them know whilst making my booking that it was my boyfriends birthday, having read the previous reviews i expected something nice to come out for him, this never happened and was really disappointing. Overall, it was really disappointing and i would not recommend coming here.

title: Cocktails with a view!
comment: We wanted somewhere to take great friends to thank them for a great night out. The Rooftop was the ideal location for this activity, with its great view of Trafalgar Square and surrounding area, attentive service and excellent nibbles - the Tempura broccoli was delicious.

title: Great experience
comment: So near to Trafalgar Square and even on a dull day a great view. Blankets are provided for chilly moments! Staff were very friendly and helpful and both the food and wine were just right. It’s not a cheap venue but well worth it in my opinion. I will be back in December to test out the blankets!

title: Rooftop drinks
comment: Went here for a few sticks on a sunny afternoon and managed to find a spot in the sun, a lot was in the shade of low October sun.  Fantastic views. Drinks ok but nowhere near the likes of some other great hotels like Claridges or The Dorchester.  We were given a table for one hour but the service was slow and the waitresses favoured chatting at the bar over seeing to guests. It cost me about £70 for 4 cocktails and the 12.5% service charge which was expensive but the views and sun made it worthwhile.  However, it's ticked off now and I would not return. If you want good, expensive drinks go to the bar at The Dorchester.

title: Fab location for a rooftop bar
comment: Very lovely hotel In a brilliant location. Decor looks new and trendy. Breakfast excellent, as was our room. Cool rooftop bar with views of Trafalgar Square. Service attentive. Good value and recommended...

title: Fantastic service with a view
comment: My friends and I had a marvellous experience on the rooftop bar. The service was impeccable and the team were able to accommodate our late arrival due to transport issues. We were greeted warmly and felt so welcomed for a few cocktails. I can’t rate the service we received highly enough. I enjoyed it so much I plan to return this weekend. The view is stunning. Especially when day turns into night. London has never looked so beautiful.

title: Could do better
comment: Great view and location but waited too long for drinks, Barman not making certain cocktails that day, not being advised of that until after waiting 20 minute fir it and very average drinks in comparison to the very high prices! Won’t be going back

title: Beautiful Views, slow service
comment: I love a sky bar and visited many in Asia, this is a stunning view and a very clean bar. The service was extremely slow first order for two cocktails took over 30 mins, The bar was not even busy! I thought when asking for the bill this would have been super quick 20 mins later!  I wish I could come back but since the cocktails are on the higher end of the budget the pace of the service is a huge flaw and though normally happy to pay that price... not so happy when the service is so poor!

title: Drinks with a view
comment: What a great place to sip a G&T with my brother in laws at midnight, overlooking Trafalgar Square and the London skyline Excellent service and range of Gins We will be back  JW

title: Birthday visit with A friend
comment: Came to the Rooftop on Friday with a friend for some drinks as a late birthday celebration. What a fantastic day! the sun was actually shining and the cocktails were amazing. The staff were all so friendly and attentive. (If I remember her name correctly), Leanne was extremely helpful and showed us around the whole Rooftop. She was so friendly and really made us both feel so welcome. Fantastic! Will definitely be back!

title: Can't beat the view but we had issues
comment: I will first say that when I stayed last year at the Trafalgar the rooftop was being refurbished. With this visit, because it was a last minute trip, the hotel was sold out and we stayed elsewhere.I still wanted to see how the Rooftop turned out after refurbishing and it did not disappoint. (until...) First visit at the rooftop: We dined in Chinatown and then walked by the Rooftop and stopped in on the odd chance that there would be a table. There was! Drinks and nibbles were reasonably priced, and as it got chilly, staff brings around blanket for the guests. (if you have a good waiter/waitress. We did not). If I had to rate this first visit, I would still say it was a FIVE. We enjoyed ourselves so much that we stopped by concierge on our way out so we could make a reservation for our last evening in London to celebrate this trip. Our reservation confirmation arrived by email. Our final evening we checked in with the concierge and were allowed to take the lift upstairs. (yes, you do stop and get permission before riding up). We were then greeted and asked if we could sit on the railing, which is a bar like area with the most direct views over the glass. We were told that not only could we not sit there, but there was no seating at all out on the rooftop. (Huh?!) We explained that we had a reservation and were told that having one did not necessarily guarantee we would be sitting outside. Isn't that the whole point?? We were taken to an inside area with ZERO views and told that we could walk outside and take photos if we liked but had to leave our drinks inside. After expressing our disappointment, there was still no apology, just a reiteration of the fact that a reservation did not guarantee we would be outside. Well...they certainly should tell you that when you make a reservation. When there is a service failure, the mark of good service is how to make it right. They could have offered a little in the way of compensation...perhaps comp one drink or a small nibble. That may or may not have altered our decision to stay. When nothing was forthcoming, we made our decision to leave. Clearly, we expected better from a property of this caliber.

title: Great bar
comment: This was the bar in our hotel or more accurately on top of our hotel. We enjoyed the views, the excellent wines and company during our visit.

title: Snazzy spot for some alternative views of the city
comment: Had a very friendly welcome, all the staff are super professional. Great food and drinks matched the impeccable views of the city.

title: Good Views But...
comment: This was my second visit to the rooftop bar, and the views are amazing. However this time we were disappointed at the lack of bubbles in our prosecco, we were informed they were poured from a new bottle but subsequently our second glasses were obviously freshly poured. I do feel at the price you pay they should have just replaced the first ones. They did a lovely surprise birthday coconut ice cream sweet which was well received. Nice venue, could do with some more shade which was the issue at my previous visit luckily we didn't stay long that time.

title: Birthday Lunch
comment: Fabulous bar , great views , food was excellent . drinks were lovely in the September sunshine , Will be back L xx

title: Awful experience, wonderful views
comment: I never write reviews but my visit to this place left me feeling fuming so I wanted to share it here. I first tried to visit this place with my girlfriend on a summer evening and was told there would be a 2-hour wait so we gave up. I decided to visit again for a second time tonight, 9pm on a Wednesday evening. The bar downstairs was literally empty, so we thought we might have better luck finding some space at the rooftop bar as well.  The reception guy could not reach the bar staff on the phone, so when a couple left while we were waiting, he just prompted us to use the lift to get to the bar. When we arrived upstairs, there was nobody at the (second) reception area, so we went on to sit on one of the available tables outside. Indeed the views looked very nice, with a summery vibe and a partial view of the London Eye.  In about 2 minutes, a young gentleman (can't tell if he was the host or a waiter, most probably the former) asked if he could help us. We asked if we can order and he said yes, so we went on and ordered 2 glasses of wine. Then he paused for a while and asked how many of us would be. I said that a friend might join us, as I was waiting for his response - the table had 4 seats and it was 2 of us so far. And then the magic happened: He just said the table was reserved and we should go either inside (!) or go to another terrace at the back, which many other reviews have described, that was empty and without any character or views. Under different circumstances we might have stayed, but I just didn't understand how we were told this only after we placed our orders? So we left, obviously, as I didn't want to make a scene. Now, reading the rest of the reviews I don't understand how you cannot reserve a specific table outside when you make a booking, and despite that, our table was specifically reserved for someone else, at 9pm, on a Wednesday night.. It kind of sounded lame and made me feel like I was unwanted for some reason. Luckily I have been to many similar establishments in London or New York, so I don't think it was something about me specifically, rather than most probably our choice of drinks which would result to a lower bill than eg. 2 cocktails and dinner. I am completely discouraged to try to visit this place again - not to worry I guess, it's in a very touristy area so there's always going to be demand for it, which is why they can get away with this attitude.  Good luck who those who try it - for the rest, there's plenty of rooftops around (even had a better experience at Radio Rooftop Bar, which I rank very very low in terms of service and attitude).

title: Amazing View
comment: It's a great location to spend some time. I didn't have a chance to try food because of their kitchen was closed for some reason at that day. But the coctails was very good and view was perfect. But you have to make reservation other wise you could send back from the door. Entrance is from hotel entrance.And also as the other London places it's expensive

title: Views to die for... great cocktails.
comment: We stayed at the hotel and we went here for cocktails after a day of sightseeing... really worth it - you have a perfect view of London's trafalgar square, the city and london eye in the distance.

title: A fabulous find
comment: Went here to celebrate husbands birthday after a lovely day sightseeing. Lovely place. Lovely staff. Well looked after. Fabulous views.

title: Great view and lovely place
comment: We booked a table here as a treat for our 2nd wedding anniversary on our day out in London.  The view is amazing and we were really lucky to have a beautiful weather day.  We ordered a couple of dishes from the menu, its a tapas style menu (around £10-14 a dish).  The food was amazing and really tasty. And really nice to just pick at as you are chatting and looking at the fab view. The staff are brilliant, attentive without being intrusive and friendly.  I am glad we booked as I can imagine it gets quite busy. It was a lovely treat for a special occasion and I would definately go back.

title: Drinks with a View!
comment: We had a really lovely time! The drinks were delicious, the service was charming, the ambience was delightful and the view was stunning!

title: Great place to catch up with friends.
comment: In spite of some awful rainy weather...we had a lovely time catching up with friends. They even turned on the heating and provided throws to cover up as it was unseasonably chilly...  Good choice of food open flat bread sandwiches and baby ribs. Second time there, would go again.... Thank you!

title: Very expensive for a bar
comment: Visited after a very nice dinner across the road. Got to terrace on the roof, spectacular views but prices prohibitive. Suggest only for very special occasions. Wouldn't want to eat there, would be extra expensive I guess.

title: Central London rooftop garden
comment: Booked a table here at short notice for drinks. Amazing views across London from Trafalgar Square. Set-up was excellent with comfy seating areas if you prefer. Choice of cocktails, wine, tea and coffee, etc. Service was spot on and made to feel like a VIP from the moment we arrived outside the restaurant.Cannot recommend enough. Also has coverings if it rains, although we went on a perfect Summer day. People complaining about prices, these are in line with any nice bar in central London.

title: Spilt drinks
comment: Unfortunately our initial enthusiasm for sitting outside in the sun with a fab view of Nelsons Column was quickly dampened when the waitress spilt 2 drinks over my friend. They took a while to respond properly too.   Nice cocktails but overpriced esp when they add service on top. Not sure I would hurry back.

title: Great views & lunch
comment: Pleasant friendly welcome It wasn’t busy enabling us to sit earlier than our reservation. Luckily the weather was great which added to a superb location for lunch. The tapas style snacks were delicious  Cocktails a good standard The table service wasn’t great clearing courses and interrupted at inappropriate times. Whilst having to chase table water & drinks

title: 50th Birthday Drinks
comment: I emailed to see if I needed to book a table for my partners 50th Birthday, they advised this as it does get busy, so i booked a table for two and just after arriving the brought over a plate with happy birthday in chocolate with a sweet in the middle, such a nice treat for a special occasion. The service on the Rooftop was 1st class, would recommend this venue for that special occasion.

title: Stunning views
comment: A lovely spot for drinks overlooking over the London skyline. Quite pricey but you get what you pay for. Staff were very attentive. Food menu offers light bites and snacks. Drinks menu very extensive.

title: Expensive, terrible service
comment: I understand this place is opposite Trafalgar Square but the prices here are far too expensive for what you get. I ordered a bottle of Sauvignon Black at £48, which was served in pub-style glasses. Ordered the salmon flatbread and it was tasteless (£10) and grilled aubergine (£8) was tiny and it seemed to have been reheated in a microwave. The staff were just wondering around looking to the floor avoiding eye contact. It did not appear to be someone in charge and waiters just gathered behind the bar chatting to each other and ignoring their customers who were waiting to be served. The table next to us just walked out after waiting long time... The main part of the bar is very nice, overlooking the square but it was fully booked and the back room (where we were) was empty without character or atmosphere with just some random plastic olive tress with Christmas lights (in August).  There are far too many roof top bars in London to try that I don't think I will ever be back.

title: Avoid
comment: On arrival we were told by the concierge that we would need to wait an hour and a half for a table at the roof top bar and suggested we had a drink in the lounge on the ground floor. We decided to do that and ordered a bottle of wine to pass the time. After half hour they said we had a table but we could only have it for 45 minutes. We decided to go with it and were told to settle our bar bill downstairs first which we did for £50. Upon exiting the lift on the top floor we were taken past the terrace with the views over Trafalgar Square (the view we were waiting for!) but we were taken to an empty room at the back by the kitchen! We expressed disappointment and asked (a) why we were told we had to wait 90 minutes and (b) why did we only have a 45 minute slot? Nothing added up. After all we gave it ten minutes and drank up and left but not without quizzing the concierge first (who was busy telling others to have a drink at the bar). It became very clear that what they get you (and possibly hundreds of similarly duped tourists) to do is run up a bill in the lounge bar first because when they take you up stairs nobody wants to stay for a drink given that the area at the back is without character and without a view but for a turnover of many other people scratching their heads expressing disappointment but not before running up a £50 bill in the waiting area down stairs. If this was a bank you could probably sue them for misleading; misrepresentation; breach of faith and probably theft. Regretfully though there is no recourse other than to ponder on how we, and no doubt countless others, are royally ripped off. Disgraceful. Avoid avoid avoid.....

title: The View (and not the TV show)
comment: Nice evening spot to take in the sights and enjoy a cocktail or two. Our family ate late night snacks after traveling, and they were all delicious. It can be crowded as you might expect, but as hotel guests, we never seemed to have a problem getting a spot.

title: Lovely views and great service
comment: Excellent location, great service and very good drinks! We signed up for the Champagne Rooftop Flight and loved the display & quality of the fare on offer.

title: Drinks after the Theatre with an amazing view
comment: Great venue and great staff. We had drinks after the Theatre and the view across London was incredible. Will definitely be back!

title: Top rooftop bar!
comment: Wow, what a find... we also went to the pub next door and luckily saw this place. Views are great, but what makes this place excellent is the service and the food!

title: Early evening drinks with colleagues -excellent alternative to a regular bar
comment: Based at the Trafalgar Hotel, by Trafalgar Square, the superb roof terrace has panoramic views over iconic London sights. We were served by Grace who was first class in terms of service, hospitality and had a great smile. The drinks are expensive but not excessive for the location. The atmosphere was good and what a great place to be on a lovely summer evening. Recommend you book and ask for an outside table. Dress smartly and enjoy the occasion.

title: Great views, great service and very welcoming staff
comment: I must say, the staff were incredibly welcoming from the lady who booked for my reservation, to the lady on the front desk on the ground floor, the ladies that showed us to our reserved seating and the 3 waiters that served us throughout our 2 hour stay on the rooftop. All were impeccably polite and friendly and it was lovely that they allowed our 13 year old daughter in until 7pm – thanks for that. There was a Lithuanian waiter that we really warmed to at the end – didn’t get his name…but he was really lovely to us.

title: Defo has the Wow factor
comment: Went on Friday night with my sister (she is local & booked two weeks in advance) once we got to rooftop bar it was amazing, fab views, was really special.
