We were lucky enough to sit on front row. The views were better than expected. Very welcoming & loved blankets on chairs if you got cold. Staff were lovely but service was very slow. We had a two hour time slot starting at 7pm. We arrived 10 mins early & were told they had had private function & were setting up. They told us to have drink in bar downstairs while waiting & they would call us. (Very expensive bar downstairs £20 for two wines, which we were not allowed to take to roof top bar) They never did & we had to chase a few times. Went in about half hour late but they said they would extend our slot which they did. Ordered a lamb (belly, £10) snack which took over an hour to arrive but once it did it was amazing. After we wanted to order lamb cutlets (starter) but our allocated time slot was running out. They said it was fine & no time pressure. Just as well as that took another hour to arrive. Had to chase a few times & in the end they did not charge us for it. We ended up staying most of the night & left at 11pm so worked out really well. Staff were very friendly & helpful. Would have got 5 stars if service better. Also asked a waitress about some of the buildings in the views & she had no idea. Think it would be nice if the staff knew what the buildings were from the views. Not cheap but think for what you get with views it is well worth it. Bottle of wine starts around £30. Snacks start around £10 & are lovely.

title: Saturday afternoon
comment: Very friendly and helpful staff. Good cocktail options and nice lunch. Very open space on the rooftop. Very nice 3 hours spent. Certainly would recommend.

title: Anniversary lunch
comment: Such a lovely find! A Great bar with lovely attentive staff. Amazing views of the city and gorgeous food. Will definitely return and next time to try the cocktails!

title: What a view
comment: This roof top bar is one of the best. Great views over the city, lots of choice of drinks and the cocktails are amazing. Very reasonable priced. We would definitely be returning.

title: Great service and food
comment: Looking at somewhere for pre theatre drinks for my daughters 18th and having looked at the other reviews, I was a little worried, but I needn't have been as the rooftop bar was fantastic from the quick drinks service to the excellent food. A great time was had by all and the bill whilst relatively high was not unexpected for the views and location. Many thanks to Reena for sorting the table, we will be back.

title: Amazing drinks and great view
comment: I came here whilst i was staying in the hotel. Hotel guests receive priority seating upstairs which is convenient as most bars are full once the working day is over.  Drinks were moderately priced, and tasted fantastic. The views were beautiful. Food was also delicious and reasonably priced.  Genuinely a lovely experience coming here

title: Rooftop bar only
comment: We visited the rooftop bar on a day trip to London. We had made reservations online and recommend you do as people who walked in on the day did mostly get turned away as there was no space. A bit of a mixed view on the visit. The view is amazing, right over trafalgar square, London Eye etc. However the menu states that they can make any cocktail on request, but all 3 that we requested we were told they couldn't make. (A daiquiri, mojito and a mocktail so nothing too out of the ordinary) staff told us they'd run out of most ingredients and that also about 6 drinks of the menu were also not available. This was at 6 pm so not the end of the evening. Surely the evening is there most popular time so would ensure they were fully stocked? The drinks we eventually chose were nice enough, pricey, but what you'd expect to pay in London. Staff were friendly and location couldn't be beaten but the lack of drinks did let it down.

title: Disappointed
comment: This place is very falsely advertised. There is a beautiful roof terrace with views of Trafalgar Square but most guests are shoved in the back area where you may as well be in a basement.  We booked in advance and the people we spoke on the phone were very accommodating. However when we got there we were told the area with the view could never be guaranteed and that they would let us know if a table became available. We kept reminding them but we weren’t seated there until 2 hours after we arrived.  The waiting staff were friendly but the hostesses were frosty. Our food order was forgotten and it was very hard to catch anyone’s attention. The food and drinks were nice, especially the Lords ladies and commoners cocktail.  When we asked for the bill they undercharged us and we told them and it took around 40 mins to get it sorted.  It was a shame we didn’t have an excellent experience because it was a special occasion for us. Unless promised the views that were advertised we wouldn’t come back.

title: Disgusted
comment: I attended a friends birthday at this Venue a few weeks back. The table was booked for 6 people and when they arrived it was only set for 4. Myself and my partner arrived a little later than the time the table was booked for and whilst our friends were enjoying their time on the rooftop, we were stood downstairs in reception for no less than 20 minutes waiting to be let up. When we arrived at the rooftop, we were squeezed through a tiny door to our friends. There was only one spare seat and with two empty tables next to us, we took a stool from there to use. A member of staff approached us and told us we weren't allowed to use that seat as there was a reservation on that table and we were to put it back. We asked for an alternative seat to be found, of which we were told they would go and get one from the other side of the bar... another 20 minutes later, one of us was still standing and so we took the seat from the table that had been 'reserved' anyway. We had bought 4 bottles of wine, a couple rounds of cocktails along with some food which arrived in dribs and drabs (all equating to around £500) when Ashley (manager number one) came over to us and said that they had had a complaint from a guest of noise. Whilst we understood, his tone was completely unacceptable and, we felt, rude and aggressive. Later on, after continual scowls from the staff for having an enjoyable evening, we were told that we were still too loud and that it was unacceptable and that we would be asked to leave without finishing our drinks (that we had paid for) if we continued. This in our eyes was completely out of order and we disputed this with him. He then raised his voice to a member of our party and went off to find Cameron (manager number two). Cameron came over and told us that we had been abusive towards manager number one and that we were being given 5 minutes to finish our drinks and leave (at this point we still had a bottle of wine on the table and a round of cocktails). We finished what we could of our drinks and left the venue, going on to a bar in Soho which was, by far, cheaper, less pretentious and with staff that appreciated the customers opinions. Reading the reviews, it seems like this is a VERY common occurrence and whilst each comment has its own templated response of 'we will look into this' I don't feel that ANYTHING is being done about the abysmal, disgusting attitude of those working/managing this venue. We will never be visiting this bar again and have spoken to two separate parties who were considering booking, advising them not to. I would advise the General Manager to seriously look into and consider this issue as continual bad reviews and situations like this will cause a huge downturn. The spot is stunning with the views over London, but this is not enough to ride on the back of if the value, service and attitude of those working there is not dealt with. Please don't invite us back... you couldn't pay me to.

title: Don’t Bother
comment: Booked a table in the ‘Roof Top’ bar. Arrived and were directed to an area with no view at all and frankly could have been anywhere.It would have been nice if it was explained to us that the (the very small area) that does have great views was busy so we are going to seat you here etc... It took 20 minutes to be served and even then that was only because I had to ask someone who was milling around not doing much ‘if they work here and if they were not too busy could we please order’ Meanwhile two ladies who had arrived at the same time as us had already given up and had gone. So we asked for two white wine spritzers to which the lady who was ‘serving’ looked blank and asked us to ‘find it in the menu’ as she had no idea what it was. Another 20 minutes later the worst white wine spritzers we have ever had arrived. Ten further minutes later, some wasabi peas  arrived with a different waitress. Asked why the slow service and was told that that evening there was only one barman (it was Friday).... Very bad vibe in this bar, music was also uninspiring.  We paid our bill (£20 - really?) and gazed at the (then closed pub next door) wishing we had made different plans... Between us we have lucky enough to have stayed and been to many nice hotels, restaurants and bars all over the world... Would we recommend this place - No.

title: Very disappointing
comment: Complete fail. I made a reservation, but no one except for reception asked for it. Communication between reception and rooftop was not existing: although we were told at reception that our table is ready, the waiter at the rooftop was unprepared for us and was not aware of our reservation. We were placed at the back of the restaurant with no view and had to wait over an hour until we were able to move to the nice part. The waitress said that not a single table got free in that period, which is hard to believe for a Friday night between 9 and 10pm (considering the 2hour restriction per table). I understand that there are only limited places on the balcony, but the advertisement is completely misleading. Also, the waitress was not friendly when she explained that we cannot move. Moreover, service was really bad and totally unorganised. There was no clear organisation and no one seemed to know who is in charge of what. Accordingly, there were many complaints and long waiting. We ordered a G&T and a cocktail: The G&T came, but we waited 10 more minutes for the cocktail! Not appropriate in a hotel like that. Drinks are too expensive. Overall not worth the money. We will not come back.

title: First date
comment: We had a great evening. The staff were attentive, the food was great, and I felt it was reasonably priced – it’s definitely somewhere I would look to come again

title: Amazing place!!
comment: This was out 4th visit to this bar, we don't feel like we can visit the city without going here. The view is amazing! You need to arrive when it is light, and wait for the sun to go down!  We had a table booked at 8pm on Saturday night for 4 of us to celebrate a birthday.  We arrived 20 mins early but this was no issue.  We didn't leave until 10.15, you could not fault the service, our waiter was lovely! The food was great, much bigger portions than we were expecting for the menu style, the menu states to get 2-3 dishes each, we had 9 between 4 of us and we couldn't finish, I would order less and you can always get more if you want to, the food came very quickly!  Lovely little touches like blankets when it gets dark.  Price wise, I would say its what you expect to pay for the location - 2 bottles of wine, 2 ciders, 9 dishes and 2 deserts was £200. In my opinion, it's a must when you are in London!

title: Can not recommend
comment: I can't believe I had the same poor experience twice. Last time we stayed in the hotel and visited this amazing view of the rooftop bar. They had very short of staff but having said that the tables around us were receiving drinks while our waiter forgot to post our food and drinks into the system. That time they had a half Arabic - Asian manager Azi or Assyz cannot recall the name sorry if I misspell. He promptly sorted out our problem, He apologized and personally looked after us (really professional young man). This type of tiny touch made a Huge difference. We promised him that we will come back and we did come back!! However, in terms of service, nothing changed apart of that the managers are new and they are not friendly. My wife was surprised when none of the managers wanted to speak with us when we ask for it. The place itself is beautiful but having said that you guys need more motivated people like your previous manager or someone who can look after the guests and make them happy!

title: Good view, appalling service
comment: I booked the rooftop for Sunday evening drinks for my boyfriends birthday. When we got there we were shown to a table not next to the side so I asked if we could move for a better view. the guy said no sorry. We ordered drinks and some food and after 5 mins, a spot next to the side became available so I asked if we could move which the waitress said it was fine. After about 3 minutes we were kicked off the table, due to another reservation. We were moved back and our food had still not arrived, meanwhile the table next to us who arrived after, had food arriving constantly and when we asked she said it was coming. 30 mins later the food turns up due to confusion with the table next to us...as I anticipated. When we asked for the bill, she gave us the table next to ours - even she knew it was wrong, not sure why she bothered. When we finally got the right bill I took the service off and said it was appalling. There was no apology. Plenty of other rooftop bars in London, I will not be returning or recommending this.

title: Disgusted
comment: Having made a booking to meet friends over from Australia this was the most dissapointing bar I have ever been to ! We were sat in the back which has no view and you could be anywhere in fact if I'd known there are so many pubs in London with really nice gardens I would have taken them anywhere but here  I asked our waitress 3 or 4 times if she could move us to the front bar but wad just ignored definitely won't go back

title: Disgusted....
comment: Booked this for me and my girlfriend months in advance for our birthdays, requested a good view, didn’t think the view we would have been given was right at the back, with a view of the next door neighbours fan systems... we requested to be on the balcony to be told it was full and sold out. After 10 mins & a bar bill of £40 in that 10 mins we left. On the way out we WAS DISGUSTED to hear A greeter talking to another greeter saying she had just accepted a walk in who she had sat on the balcony with the views over London.... THIS WAS A BALCONY THAT WAS “SOLD OUT” the place stinks!!! Stay away

title: Can I score it a minus?
comment: After checking the website daily for a number of weeks, finally I was able to book the date I wanted in mid july when they were made available in May. I emailed with a couple of requests over the following weeks and received emails back to say that requests had been noted and would be met if possible. I then phoned a couple of weeks ago to make an amendment to the booking, I was told this was fine and confirmed Today I receive a voicemail advising that due to a clash on the booking system, my booking was to be cancelled..... I phoned to check this and was told that the table I required was indeed available, and instantly received an email to confirm my booking. I then immediately receive another call from the bar to advise my booking was to be cancelled? This was within minutes of the confirmation email being received I asked how there could be a booking clash when I booked early morning on the day the tables were released? I was told that a booking of 180 people was already in the system and the date shouldn't have been released How can I book a table in May, exchange several calls and emails with staff all confirming the booking over the following weeks, then a week before we're due to attend be cancelled due to a pre existing booking? A booking that clearly no member of the staff other than this one girl was aware of and she decided to conveniently blame it on the booking system? I spoke to two girls from the same bar in a matter of minutes, one said I have the table yet another insists they're expecting 180 guests...Which I don't believe for a second Don't bother booking. This was to be part of a birthday weekend that had been meticulously planned, only for this unorganised, inept, thoughtless establishment to phone up with lies.  Based on the recent terrible reviews, there's a good chance we've had a near miss to be honest. Londons a big city, find somewhere else

title: TERRIBLE SERVICE , arrogant and inept staff
comment: Booked a table , but took 10 mins for anyone to offer us a drinks menu , had to ask . Drinks took forever . When we were eventually asked for our food order we were then told the kitchen was busy and food would be at least 25 mins but we could get chips a little quicker . Not what we wanted at all and we were going on to theatre so needed it to be quick . I explained this , they apologised , brought us some nuts to have as apology and said no charge . The bill took forever and when it did come was charged £8 for the "free" nuts ?!  It has a great view but they REALLY need to get the service and front of house in order. Will not be going again

title: Awful customer service
comment: We live in South Africa and were visiting London with family on a special vacation. We had found the Rooftop St. James and were excited about going here. We made the reservation in May for July 6th at 6.30 pm for 5 people including my Mum, wife and two kids. I was especially careful to review the entire website to see if there were restrictions about kids, there were none. We travelled into London for our meal, from Pinner (where my Mum lives - costing nearly 40 pounds on the tube) with great excitement. Upon arrival, we were informed we would not be allowed to take our reservation because no kids were allowed after 6.00 pm. I informed the manager of the fact this is not stated on the website anywhere and that this was a special occasion. Despite being at fault, he was unwilling to honour our booking. I have never been so appalled or disgusted by a company's ineptitude or customer service. I sincerely recommend avoiding this place in order to avoid the disappointment me and my family had to experience!

title: Great afternoon with friends
comment: We went for pre theatre drinks/nibbles at The Rooftop on a beautiful sunny afternoon with some good friends. The service was friendly and the cocktails and beer were cold! The finger food was tasty, well cooked and delicious. It isn’t cheap, but the time flew past as the afternoon was so enjoyable. The views are brilliant over Trafalgar Square and the atmosphere is relaxed, just remember to fill your wallet!

title: Superb
comment: Popped in for some pre theatre drinks. I must confess to being slightly nervous given some of the reviews.  It was excellent, great service, attentive staff and lovely food (although I only had a snack). Great views in a great location.  All you could want in a rooftop bar.  We will go back.

title: Nice views but shocking service
comment: Beautiful views if you manage to get a table out the front and not in the conservatory area. Book in advance for a 2 hour slot and specify you want the views. If it's full when you arrive then ask to be moved once a table becomes free. We turned up early on a Saturday afternoon but were still allowed up and sat in the conservatory for a short while but were soon moved out to the balcony area and left at our allotted time. It was nice we weren't rushed out, however service was unreliable to say the least. We had several offers to take our order as we first arrived but hadn't been given menus, once we had decided what we wanted there was no-one around. When we finally ordered the 7 drinks, they took an eternity to arrive such that we asked twice where they were and then the most straight forward vodka lime and lemonade took a further two asks. At no point were we asked if we wanted more drinks, we always had to accost someone and then wait an age for them to arrive. Probably just as well given the price of them but on a bright sunny day, we definitely would have consumed more. When the bill came up, we had been charged for 4 drinks we never had. Once pointed out, they were removed without issue but I'd be interested how many people just pay without checking. This place is a lovely retreat away from the hustle and bustle but poor service and staff is really letting it down. Its not cheap, our bill came to almost £300, so I'd spend your hard earned money elsewhere.

title: Dreadful service from beginning to end
comment: Be warned, trying to even make a reservation is traumatic.. I am unable to speak any foreign language with any degree of accuracy, or skill. The same can be said for the reservation teams grasp of English. How many times do I have to repeat a date, and a time, and my name, I have many friends of different nationalities, but I would not employ any of them in a London restaurant if they cannot understand ‘ may I reserve a table for 2 please’. The comms were so bad, they even failed to send my email confirmation, so a day later I called and just to check they had the details, they didn’t know if they had ( what ? ) and promised a grown up would call me back, of course no one called. I emailed the reservation team, they ignored this also. Haha, possibly worst organised establishment I have ever dealt with.

title: Fun place for tapas and wine !
comment: Great views of London and Trafalgar Square. All the choices for tapas were delicious. Music was great too.

title: Roof top bar
comment: Good food but shockingly poor waiters. Really no idea so drinks take a long time and amateur service from what should be a top end hotel based on location and price.  Numerous people left due to lack of service at all and we managed to get served but it took some effort. Manageress intervened and apologised then deducted service charge.

title: Great views
comment: We visited mid week around 330 in the afternoon and went straight up to the bar. I have been before but was seated at the back bar not knowing the front bar existed. If you can manage to get a seat at the front of he building you get great views of Trafalgar Square ; Nelsons column and the London Eye. The views from he back bar are less impressive . I had two of the cheaper glasses of wine at £9 a glass. It was decent enough. At the end of the day -you are paying for the view. Very enjoyable

title: Great venue undermined by arrogance and some really poor service
comment: So what a stunning location. But Hilton Corporation perhaps you need to remind yourself that you are a global hotel brand and NOT a deeply boutique bar.  I get that you need to restrict access to reservations only. But don't then have a check in desk where you have to wait whilst the receptionist spends 5 minutes on a work call unrelated to the rooftop bar. All she had to do was check a name and reservation for heavens sake ( and this performance was repeated 3 times across our party of 4). Next up - if you are going to close half of the outdoor section to make a Hilton promotional video ( in this case with "Bastille" on 9 June) then at least have the courtesy to warn of this both at the time of booking AND on arrival. Had we known in advance we'd have gone elsewhere - but nothing. That said watching some overwrought and over important "luvvies" stressing over camera angles was rather amusing. And to be fair to the film crew, they had the courtesy to apologise for the disruption they were causing to us, unprompted. Not a word came from Hilton staff until I complained. Unfortunately our waitress from the bar had presumably spent the morning sucking on lemons and pulling out her own fingernails judging by her face and manner. But let's also call out some positives that suggest how good this location could be. The food, whilst expensive, was very good. The waitress who served the food ( whose name sadly I didn't get) was charming. To aid in positive identification for very positive service, she was of Afro-Carribean heritage - and delightful.  When I complained to " the lemon sucker" about the constant interruptions to our lunch, she offered to knock the DISCRETIONERY service charge off the bill. Wow - customer service hits a new low! So step in - at my insistence - duty manager Aziz, who was extremely apologetic, very understanding and generally very impressive. We quickly reached an accommodation over a reasonable reduction to the bill, for which I thank him. So what a great location let down by poor business practice on arrival; corporate arrogance; and one very miserable staff member. That really is somewhat pathetic for a brand like Hilton. Clone Aziz and our food waitress - re-engineer a customer friendly check-in proceed - and put your customers first rather than treat them as an afterthought - and this can be a great venue.

title: Views are a must but.......
comment: So thought would try this little rooftop as was in the area. The views are amazing here and this is a great selling point for the bar. Was welcomed by friendly staff and shown to a perfect position over looking Trafalgar Square and shown menu....food looked stunning but not much choice, could do with a few more items , but can not fault the food i ordered The only problem I had here was that when finished my drinks i had to go to the bar as staff not always around, to be told only table service, dont think i should have to wait for a top up ..... Also at end ordered a coffe to finish came , but no sugar so again had to go ask at the bar ....just needs a bit more attention on the guests by staff but this is a must to go. I recon at night this is a special place.

title: Not worth it!
comment: Photos looked amazing however upon arrival, staff were quite rude and didn’t seem to know much about anything. The exposed rooftop drinking area is non-smoking and if you intend to have a cigarette, you need to go to the entrance of the bar on the ground floor (8 floors lower)  It was also very busy which is expected however despite the view, everything else is just your average bar. Prices are high. Wouldn’t recommend.

title: Great food and views
comment: I visit this rooftop bar quite often. The views are amazing. It is great for lunch or dinner. They have blankets and heaters for colder days. I would recommend booking a table beforehand.

title: I had a great night
comment: Perhaps, reading all the reviews now, I have been lucky, and had the fortune smile on me, but returning here for the first time after the refurb, everythingelseis was top notch. I was seated at the Gallery, which affords the most spectacular views of London. The cocktails were great, I had Skyline and Aviation (both good) and barman awesome, he eveb came out from behind the bar to advise what I could have after my other drink. All the staff (boys mostly Italian) were super friendly, and my food waiter, the French girl Dorien lovely. The food was fantastic, pricey but excellent. Tuna on the raw portion of the menu exquisite, miso Aubergine also very good, and Korean beef skewers super tasty! The views are stupendous ( but do ask to sir against the glass in the Gallery are a when booking). Jeffrey the manager was in control, staff treating him, rightly, as a a conductor of sorts. Heartily enjoyed tonight's experience,

title: Fantastic views over Trafalgar Sq
comment: Ate here on a beautifully hot sunny afternoon. The views are fantastic which is why this review has 4 stars, probably a 3 otherwise.  The food is nice enough although the tempura was greasy, not cooked in hot enough oil!  The wine is nice and all is priced to match the view Worth a visit though

title: Drinks in the sun
comment: Ok this is my new place to go when coming to London in the summer.  What a great view to just sit and drink wine, cocktails and eat.  Spent a glorious few hours here in the sun  London prices but great view !  Will come again

title: Shame about the service
comment: Great location. But: very poor service.. Very expensive. Automatically put 12.5% service charge for appalling service. Someone needs to get their act together and organise this place which has great potential.

title: Hotspot
comment: We enjoyed a light lunch in the sun high above the crowds with fabulous views. The food was delicious, but the service was poor. Had to ask for water twice and then we asked for the bill twice. It didn't spoil our experience, but there is a weak link, which otherwise I would have given an excellent score. I Recommend the salmon flatbread and the black cod .... and a glass of Prosseco!

title: Stick with drinks only. Food is average at tops.
comment: Just had lunch at the Rooftop. The view is goid if you are an early bird as we are. Seat with view over london eye and Trafalgar square are very limited and there is a strong chance you will not have it if you arrive 15-20minutes late for your time slot. We ordered food for lunch and it was just ok and certainly not worth the money. Black Cod at 24gbp felt reheated as opposed to freshly made. Beef skewers were okeish but on the level of highstreet take away as opposed to high end bar. Go for drinks only and it will feel an ok value for money.

title: BEWARE £5 per head CAKEAGE CHARGE!!!!
comment: Working nearby, we used to come here after work regularly, so were pleased to hear it was being refurbished ready to 2018. The refurb has made it lovely and modern, they have also expanded the rooftop to include many more tables - covers and heating options were great for when the weather gets chilly in the evening. Front bar has FAB views over London and Trafalgar Square. However, although the Back bar is still outside, the views are not much to write home about - so make sure you check where you are being seated if you want the view. We went recently in May 2018 for a colleagues birthday. We had a group of 15 people. Menu nice, but "sharing plate" options are limited and expensive, plus too small in portion size to be any good for groups over 2 or 3 persons. Service was in general good and attentive. Beware however - they charge £5 "cakeage charge", per person. Having bought our own birthday cake from Caffe Concerto, we asked if they could bring a few plates and forks. Despite buying a decent number of bottles of wine, and some sharing foods - when the bill came, we were all shocked at this extra cost. There should have been a warning upfront about this from one of our waiters - as this is a significant extra cost.  As some people had left by the end of the evening, the remaining guests then had to make up the extra costs. Had we known upfront, this could have been avoided. In fact, had we known upfront, we probably wouldn't have bought the cake or chosen this venue to host a birthday party!  Very disappointing end to an otherwise nice bar experience.

title: Kevin & Jane's pre Birthday lunch drinks
comment: This is a fab place with great views over London's skyline. Situated overlooking Nelson's Column it's an ideal, central place to meet. The welcome was warm, the staff friendly and the service fast and efficient. The drinks and food selection was wide and although the prices weren't the cheapest, they were seriously good value given the location and outlook. Well worth a visit although booking might be advisable at busy times.

title: Disappointed with our visit
comment: I booked our visit online, but also followed up with an email direct. I managed to book at the time I wanted online however I recieved an email back stating they didn’t have the time or date I wanted. I responded to this saying not to worry I had booked online and managed to get a table. What was odd about this was when my partner and I arrived it wasn’t very busy where we were sat so couldn’t understand why we would have been told there was no tables available via email.  On arrival staff were very unfriendly and also unhelpful. On the cocktail menu it does state you can ask for other cocktails if you wish, when I asked if they could do a cocktail I liked the waitress abruptly said no with no follow up of what they could offer. It took us approximately 25 mins to get our drinks and about 15 mins to get some tap water.  Part way through our visit we asked if we could sit on another table which we saw was free with the better view, our waitress said she’d ask her colleague and come back to us but unfortunately never did.  Even though the view is spectacular from one side of the rooftop we weren’t sat there so didn’t get to enjoy the view. Overall disappointed with the service considering the price we paid for four drinks.

title: Slow service and overpriced mediocre drinks
comment: Whilst the view is one of the best to be had from one of central London’s few outdoor rooftop bars, the enjoyment ends there.  The staff were unfriendly. Didn’t feel valued as a customer. The service was incredibly slow and the cocktails definitely were not worth the wait. The chocolate cherry “signature” cocktail was probably one of the most vile yet bland tasting drinks I’ve ever tasted - and I’m including cough medicine in that list. To top it off, they are super-expensive. Be warned!  There are far friendlier bars, that do better mixed drinks, pretty much everywhere else around.

title: Great views
comment: Not a cheap place to go, but the views are excellent. You are paying that bit extra due to the location but it is worth it.

title: Homeopathic portions delight the palate but not for long
comment: So my favourite and well heeled art dealer nephew decides to treat me to a lunch and recommends the Rooftop for the views and the food, he brings all his clients here, I am anticipating a treat. We turn up, can they fit us in, do we have a reservation? no, we'll see if we can fit you in, oh thanks, it appears they can accommodate us which is nice seeing as how the restaurant is half empty, perhaps we could just have been waved up and in but no we have to go through the front desk rigmarole. Fair enough this is Piccadilly after all. "I want to show the view" he says but as we turn to step onto the balcony we are told that unfortunately it will not be possible to let us take our lunch there as there is a private function, we were allowed to step out briefly and the view is magnificent. Ah well, we take a table, order drinks which come promptly. I ask for some water with my whisky and am given a glass of water, perhaps there are no jugs available and I'm a dab hand with glass manipulation so I manage manfully not to spill a drop> We are then left alone for a while, quite a while, quite a long while. I appreciate this non pushy waitering style but now i'm getting hungry. So we order, my nephew informs me that the black cod is worth a go and so I agree, lets have it. We chat, we catch up, we drink, we order more drink and realise the meal has not arrived, we have been here half an hour, the waiter checks for us and also I overhear for the table next to us and suddenly the food is with us. I am slightly confused as I am confronted with 3 one inch square pieces of black cod. I look at my nephew, is this a starter or a main course I inquire, he doesn't know, he tells me that last time he came there was a lot more fish on the plate. I ask the waiter. He is not sure so he enquires and returns with the news that this is indeed the main course. I am bemused. The portions are the size of dice set nicely upon 3 strands of grated carrot and a flower of some kind. Is this a new trend I ask my companion, is this a homeopathic restaurant where we are given a brief taste of what the food could be? It is absolutely delicious but at £40 odd a plate I would expect it to be. I snuck a look at his bill, naughty I know but I was fascinated. We decided that we were still hungry and so at 1.55pm we asked if we could order something else. No. What? No the kitchen is not taking new orders, they are dealing with a private function on the balcony and so no more food is available. But those people over there are ordering food? the waiter shrugs. I eavesdrop on the two tables next to me. A waiter has just delivered them 2 plates which they are refusing. they point out that it has taken so long for these dishes to arrive that they assumed they had been forgotten and so they are not interested. The waiter has a hard time understanding their point of view but eventually she takes the food back. At the same time the table behind me asks if they can have their food which coincidentally as luck would have it is the same dish as the tardy food that has been returned. I watch a brief conversation between two waiters and then that very food is presented to the table behind me, they fall on it with cries of delight and relief. Meantime the other table is still discussing their experience, I am tempted to join in but then realise I am too hungry to make any sense, so we leave and I visit a local sushi because the taste of black cod has whetted my appetite. I inquire as to whether my high-spending nephew will be bringing his clients here again. "I fear not uncle" he says with a charming smile, "I fear not. the area is awash with fine dining opportunities"

title: 10th Wedding Anniversary Surprise
comment: My husband surprised me by taking me here for our 10th wedding anniversary and the views over London were just fantastic. We had the fixed menu which consisted of 3 courses and a glass of prosecco. The staff were really friendly and although it was busy, we were not rushed and we could take our time and enjoy the view. The only thing was it was a really hot day and where we sat became a bit of a hot box.  The food was incredible, portions were small, but just right for me and every bite was pure pleasure. I was unsure if the food would be good due to location etc, but it really was excellent quality.  It is not the cheapest experience but it was a real treat to go there.

title: Beautiful view - fancy drinkis
comment: We went to the Rooftop for after dinner drinks and to enjoy the view. The view is gorgeous. The drinks are pricy, but worth it if you are out for a special night. It was a chilly night and the blankets they had out on the chairs appreciated.

title: Most of it was lovely
comment: Arrived for the value 3 courses for £31. Food was good but you might want to order extra side dishes but was brilliant value for money. Went to the open bar area which was amazing with stunning views of London and all the famous landmarks. Outside area has blankets which was a lovely touch. Think they would be onto a winner with more sofa type seats. Loved it and the drinks were a reasonable price for what you get. Only one complaint - the security who paced around most of the evening back and forth and I was actually followed they were also quite rude to me so it spoilt the night after that.

title: Lunch on the weekend
comment: I was really really underwhelmed by the service here...The waitress was totally inattentive and seemed inexperienced who served us initially and the person after her not much better - there was no eye contact so hard to get her attention..Amongst our food, most of it was almost cold when it arrived so we sent some of it back and the tempura which came back seemed like it had been re heated in a microwave...I got the impression that the food had been cooked and left for some time before it had been served..The drinks were decent but no olives or celery in the bloody Mary which for £15 seemed a bit lacking in finish...The view was great but generally a very disappointing and over priced experience ...

title: Great spot for drinks in a central location!
comment: I was a big fan of the Rockwell bar at The Trafalgar Hotel, and decided to visit the new Roof Top bar for drinks, I must say this bar has some amazing character, not to mention an amazing view. The service is exceptional, attentive and the drinks and food is equal. The bar is situated in a very central location so easy for the theatre, with a great atmosphere, totally recommended, a reservation is adviseable to avoid disappointment!

title: Surprise 40th birthday celebration
comment: Having enjoyed this bar some years ago in its previous incarnation as Vista, I knew it would be the perfect place to begin my niece's surprise 40th birthday treat. It has undergone a huge transformation and is now even more spectacular.  The views are incredible and the cocktails amazing. Standard pricing for a hotel of this calibre. We didn't eat there as we had a reservation for afternoon tea at The Ritz but will definitely go back this summer to try the food. We had great tables ensuring the best views out over Trafalgar Square and the London skyline.  Would not hesitate to recommend but would advise booking ahead. Great place for a special celebration, especially on a beautiful day, as yesterday was.  Many thanks to Karim and his staff for making our visit an occasion to remember.

title: Outstanding Service, Atmosphere and Drinks
comment: Recently visited The Rooftop on Saturday evening to treat a special lady. I'v been to a number of rooftop bars so had reasonable expectations coming to The Trafalgar. At the entrance of the rooftop we were greeted by the General Manager, Karim who made us feel very welcome and ensured we would be well looked after for the evening. We ordered prosecco and a couple of cocktails (recommend the chocolate and cherry!) and were well attended to by Justin who was serving our table. The cocktails came promptly and were dangerously good!! During our drinks Karim occasionally popped over to check how everything was, which was a lovely touch given it was our first visit here. The ambiance was just right, they do not over crowd the rooftop which helps give it an exclusive and comfortable feel. You won't get better views in London and we caught the end of the sunset which was perfect. Thank you to Karim and his team for giving us a memorable evening, we will be returning!

title: Perfect birthday celebration
comment: We reserved our table via email a couple of days before for a birthday celebration. Upon arrival, we were directed to the reception desk which for the The Rooftop. We had arrived c.20 minutes earlier but a quick enquiry confirmed our table was already available. The birthday guest was name-checked upon arrival which was a nice touch.  One of the guests was unable to drink alcohol so a delicious "mocktail" was provided as an alternate. The views across London - mainly Nelson's Column and across to the south of the London Eye are spectacular. The friendly staff provide woollen blankets as the evening goes on for guests who get chilly - there are also heaters located to seated inner tables only. We were also able to adjust our dinner reservation to slightly earlier via the Rooftop staff given we had enjoyed pre-dinenr drinks and were ready to dine. Overall a great experience and one I would repeat.

title: Great place for drinks and nibbles with a STUNNING view of London
comment: The rooftop bar at the Trafalgar hotel is the perfect destination for any occasion. A group of us went last weekend for my fiancé's birthday and we were thoroughly looked after. Fab service, great music, and most importantly, STUNNING views! Thankfully it was a warm evening but even when it did start to get cold the staff brought out cosy blankets! We'll definitely be going there lots over the summer!

title: Great place
comment: Service - very good. (if any thing too many waiting staff for a small area !!) Views - directly overlooking Nelson's column in Trafalgar Square. London eye to the other side in a distance.  Area - a tad small. But therein lies its exclusivity. You are paying for the exclusive experience. Had drinks (beer and wine) and a portion of broccoli. Enjoyed the views, the experience and the service.

title: After theatre drinks
comment: You definitely need to book if you want to guarantee getting in. Two other couples where turned away when we arrived as they had not not booked, they where told the bar was full but when we got up to the Rooftop there was at least 4 empty tables.  Fantastic views, great service but expensive drinks.....

title: Wet and cold
comment: Booked this for a treat as family were visiting for the day from the North, we were informed on arrival before we even ordered a drink that we would have to leave by 17 30 hrs , we has only arrived at 16 30 hrs as this was time I had booked table for. They had a private function booked in but we were told we could return again after they had finished on terrace. It was cold wet and the heaters were not working, view was very good , apart from that first impression was not good.

title: Terrible service. Uninspired cocktails.
comment: We just wanted a quick pre meal cocktail in an interesting place. The first barrier was the concierge in the hotel stopping us from entering the lift , then having to check if there was a table. As guests in the hotel we were given entry. On arrival at the rooftop there were plenty of tables inside - in fact there was only 1 other couple in the area we were taken to.  We were sat down having been told it was table service and then ignored. It took a long while for our order to be finally taken. I had ordered a Martini with an olive. This is not what arrived. Taking payment was so slow we went and paid at the bar on our way out  If you are inside there is only a view of the cranes . The decor and furniture is utilitarian and dull  Not at all what a west end bar should be like

title: Chilling Indulgence
comment: Yes it was very cold, but the heaters did their job, the cocktails were great and the food was too. Expensive ( and watch out for the discretionary service charge added to the bill) but for the view and for the experience it's a great treat.

title: You pay for the views
comment: The bar is nice, cocktails are nice, but you are paying for the view. If you simply want a drink there's lot of other cheaper bars.  We booked a table, and just had a couple of drinks, there is no need to order any snacks. 2 x cocktails, and 2 x vodkas came to £65  Worth the experience but would not visit on a regular basis.

title: Fun Place
comment: We went here to celebrate a friends engagement and we were not disappointed. We had a fantastic time. The food was good, the drinks were great and the service was brilliant. There were 7 of us in total and not one of us had a bad experience.  The atmosphere here was great it had a really fun vibe with everyone having a good night. We didn't sit outside as it was too cold but we did get to experience the view at the end and it was fabulous.

title: Awful experience
comment: The worst dinner experience in London. The portion of food was small and the taste is bad. Service was extremely bad. The waiter of our table kept ignoring us and the food came about one and a half hour after we ordered it. Generally, it was the worst dinner experience I have ever had in London.

title: So worth the view
comment: As a Londoner, it's so nice to see your home town from a different prospective. I was a little concerned when I was told they didn't have my reservation when I booked 3 days before arriving (one star deducted).  My visit was purely for the roof top bar and not as a hotel guest.  Fortunately the weather whilst cold was clear and bright so we were lucky. Cocktails were on the "small" side so we only stayed for a couple. View is so worth it!

title: Booked a roof top table, to be told it’s not guaranteed.
comment: Stayed here 2 times before. On check in we asked about the roof top bar and was told if you want a table you need to book. So we did and we came back early to enjoy the night view. When we got up to the bar, a young lady showed us to a table for two. As we started to sit down another couple who apparently had an inside table declared they were sitting there as they had moved from inside because they liked our table better. I was shocked that the waitress instead of saying sorry to the other couple who already had had drinks at another table, told us the table was no longer available and just because we booked a table does not mean you will get one. Despite my complaints we were offered a table out the way in a cold in heated area or to add salt to our wounds could have the other couples table they did not want. Turned out this other couple were not even hotel guest, but had just come for a drink, I can only assume friends of the waitress. When I tried to complain none of the staff actually cared at all. Avoid this hotel if you are hoping that the young staff will actually care that you booked a table, if their friend want to have a drink. This was Saturday 31st March management if you want to look into it. Last time we stay there.

title: Wow a meal deal that did exactly what it said on the tin
comment: I cannot say how I ended signed up to Bookatable Michelin meal deals but this was the 4th one we have tried in a month and all but 1 have been excellent, (read my other reviews to discover the 1 very poor one). This was a £32 3 course deal with a glass of prosecco included. My husband and I both started with the confit duck salad, I had the salmon fillet teriyaki as my main and my husband had the honey soy baby pork ribs. In actual fact we both had half of each which was lovely. For dessert we both had the caramel miso ice cream with crumbled cookies as there were only 2 choices and the other contained coconut which I don't like. I am not a fan of desserts but this was really delicious. The whole meal was not over facing, maybe not enormous portions for someone with a very big appetite but plenty for us. I note several reviews saying the service was poor, our service was excellent (thank you Carolina), however we were eating at a very quiet time. We had a very nice bottle of Merlot for £33 too. Would happily eat here again. I would recommend booking as I understand it can get very busy.

title: Great Views
comment: Following full refurbishment and expansions; hotel lobby areas looks great and stylish. There are great views on rooftop and expansion really works here. However, they have arranged a big part as a restaurant and put a big open kitchen where a bar with a view would suit better. The restaurant side was nearly empty despite DJ, there were couple of people who were enjoying their drinks! Cocktails are great, staff very helpful and professional. It is great place for socialising while enjoying majestic Trafalgar Square views. Overall great place and I would definitely suggest this place after dinner drinks and coctails

title: Lovely view and great service
comment: We reserved a table as heard it can get very busy especially as it has just reopened. The outdoor area is lovely and the chairs are really comfy and their are even blankets outside in case it's chilly. There are lots of drinks on the menu. The cocktails are around £15 and a glass of wine about £10. Def not unreasonable prices especially considering the location. The staff are fantastic. Thank you for a special Afternoon!

title: Great view on top of Trafalgar Hotel
comment: On top of the Trafalgar Hilton property this rooftop bar is located. It's not a very big rooftop bar, therefore not sure how they handle visitors that are not guests in the hotel, on both occasions that I had a drink here I was a guest at the hotel and had not issues in getting in.

title: Amazing view
comment: Me and the wife visited for lunch (meat and cheese platter) and cocktails on a promotion deal. Great for a special occasion as the cocktails start at £15.00. Only stayed for 2 drinks because of the price but really enjoyed our stay with amazing views over looking Trafalgar Square.

title: Nice lunch. Great views.
comment: Popped in for some lunch early November 2017. Had been prior to the refit. Still the same high service. Great views across London. Snacks and drinks very nice. Tried a few cocktails and was not disappointed. Recommended.

title: Fantastic view
comment: We went there for drinks only and got a table outside overlooking the Trafalgar square. We were there in midday and we did not book in advance. The service was quick but perhaps a little formal or dry. I would recommend this at least for the drinks and the view.

title: Not for the riff raff...
comment: Great views and great service cannot recommend this place enough.. Food and cocktails we're high standard...

title: Best rooftop restaurant/bar of London
comment: I can vouch for this place as I have been there many times and have fond memories of this place from my college days. This place is chic, a little expensive and very centrally located at the Trafalgar Square. Do try the cocktails and lobster/prawns

title: Great views!
comment: We visited this bar on a Saturday evening. Great music, good atmosphere, and great service. It gets busy, so pre-booking is advisable. We were there for drinks only, so I cannot comment on the food. Well worth a visit.
